The tablets will also expose them to more complex texts, allow my ELL's to acquire language faster, and serve as an additional technological resource in the classroom.
needStatement: My students need two tablets, cases, and screen protectors in order to allow more accessibility and exposure to complex texts and educational websites to improve literacy.

name: Where Did My Crayons Go?
description: Have you ever had a project that you couldn't do because you couldn't find your supplies? My students are wonderful five and six year olds. Our school is located in a very rural part of our county and many of our students come from very high poverty homes. My students are so eager to learn new things and love school. They are like little sponges ready to absorb knowledge. I am requesting pencil bags for my students as well as hot glue sticks that will be used for various projects in our classrooms. Each of my students are responsible for keeping up with their own supplies such as pencils, crayons, glue, etc. These new pencil bags will help keep them organized. Almost everything that we do in our classroom requires one of the mentioned supplies. Precious time is wasted when we have to locate additional supplies for students that may have lost theirs because their pencil bag wouldn't zip or had a hole in it. My students deserve so much more than I can provide for them on my own. These pencil bags will help to teach my students how to be responsible for their belongings. Having our supplies easily accessible is crucial for time management.
needStatement: My students need pencil bags and glue sticks so that they can keep up with their supplies for writing.

name: Workshop Model Works
description: In my classroom, I utilize the readers/writers workshop model. It is a teaching model that emphasizes a community of learners, student-centered learning, and differentiation. I teach 4 periods of 9th grade Language Arts and 1 period of 10th grade Language Arts at a diverse, public school. My classes are diverse in every sense of the word. I have students that come from different countries, cultures, and backgrounds. The workshop model works in classes like mine because it makes the learning environment feel safe, the lessons more clear, and the students feeling empowered. The materials that I am requesting are needed to make the students' learning and workshop model more successful. The chart paper allows me to teach students a lesson and then post the lesson on the walls of my classroom, so students can refer back to it if they need help. The folders help students to organize their work and the clipboards help students when they write notes while in the meeting area, away from their desks. I truly believe in this teaching model and I have personally witnessed the benefits of it in the students' success. The donations to this project will help my students become more successful in their learning.
needStatement: My students need file folders, clipboards, and supplies that are used in the readers/writers workshop model.

name: Nothing in Non-Fiction
description: Imagine trying to explain magnetism without magnets or magnification without magnifying glasses. The only non-fiction resources available for my students are some books and a dinosaur puzzle. My students are in the amazing world of kindergarten where learning requires a lot of hands-on activities! My students love math and get excited about interesting and odd things. They all come with amazing and different personalities. Our school is very close-nit and small, but we can make a huge impact! With the materials I'm requesting my students will have access to many non-fiction materials including magnets, light and sound activities, puppets of other cultures and more. This will give them the hands-on materials they need to experiment with the things they are learning about in Science and Social Studies. The materials will be placed in their non-fiction center where they can experiment with each one. These materials will make a difference in the lives of my students because it will give them the opportunity to truly experiment with things they are learning about which will cultivate a curiosity and love of learning in them. These students may truly be the ones who grow up and make an amazing discovery, find the cure for cancer, or become a great leader!
needStatement: My students need materials for their Non-Fiction center including books that tell about other cultures, magnets and movement kits.

name: Ink Needed
description: By the end of the school year, I would like for all of my students to be able to read. My biggest challenge is not having enough books on their reading level. My students are very busy kindergarteners. They love to learn and enjoy being challenged. My students are very excited and eager to read. They have been working very hard learning to identify the letters and sounds, in addition to blending words. I am very proud of them. My students need ink for our class printer. Having a supply of ink in my classroom will allow me to print books on their reading level. They will be able to take these books home to read with their families. Besides having their own books to take home, our class library will have enough books to read during center time. Students will be encouraged to read at home. My hopes is that each child develops a love of reading. This project will allow me to print books according to the student's reading ability. It will also allow me to print in color to engage and motivate student learning.
needStatement: My students need ink for our class printer.

name: It's Going To Be A Long Winter!
description: My students work hard everyday and are very eager to learn. I would love to reward them with educational games to play during indoor recess. My students are between the ages of 8 and 9 years old. They live in a small, family-oriented town. They come from diverse backgrounds. Our school is an older building that has much character and history. My students love to learn and are currently working on mastering their multiplication facts! My students have been playing the same board games during indoor recess since I began teaching. Over the years, pieces have gotten lost and ripped. Our playground is all paved so the students can not play outside during the winter if there is any snow or ice on the ground. These new educational games will keep them entertained during the long winter months! These educational games will provide enjoyment for years to come for my students. Many of these games are ones I enjoyed as a child and I will love to share them with my students. The pencil sharpener will allow them to easily sharpen pencils so they can draw in addition to playing!
needStatement: My students need a new pencil sharpener and educational games.

name: Kindles in the Classroom Part 2
description: Have you ever spent time in a first grade classroom? Well, if you haven't, let me just tell you... first graders are excited! They love learning! They love singing and dancing. They love games and hands-on activities. They love reading, science, and math! They just love learning! It makes me smile! Like I said, my students love reading. Here's the thing: My school serves a very diverse population. Some first graders come to school reading words and even sentences. Other children enter first grade as emergent readers, still working on letter identification and letter sounds. The widest range of learners are found in first grade. Reading levels range from Level A to Level J. Wow! We spend a great deal of time working in small groups, addressing the skills individual students need to strengthen. I spend many hours researching the best ways to meet my students' needs. Technology is one tool that can be used in a variety of ways to help me meet those needs. My school believes in technology. We've made fundraising efforts for technology support. However, most of that technology is used by students in grades 2-6. My classroom has 2 desktop computers for students to use. I would like to change that. I want to provide another form of technology for my students that supports their learning. Kindle now offers many high quality learning apps that cover a range of learning skills and levels. My goal is to furnish my classroom with at least 6 Kindles. I have one project underway for our first Kindle. This project will fund our second. Because my students come to me with a range of reading levels, it is very important for them to have as much time as possible reading books and other material on their independent levels. Kindles allow students to independently practice reading, working with words, comprehension skills, you name it! One more plus-A Kindle can also be used to practice essential Math skills! This Kindle project will allow my students to work at their independent levels and instill greater self-confidence and motivation to learn! My first graders love technology and jump at the chance to use the computer! I know they will love using Kindles, as well. And honestly, when you love working with something, the learning just comes!
needStatement: My students need Kindle eReaders to use in small group and independent reading/phonics practice, a stylus, and a screen protector to use with the eReader.

name: Whiteboards
description: My students are very active and need to be engaged in their learning. Using whiteboards individually helps each student practice standards and skills to be successful in 1st grade. The whiteboards will help them quickly practice without wasting a lot of paper. The children in my district come from various ethnic and economic backgrounds. All the children have the desire to learn. Some, do not have the family support necessary to encourage success. My students want to be cared about and want positive reinforcement for their good deeds. Our school tries to provide the children with a 'family' style atmosphere, hoping that each child thrives in his/her life. My students need double-sided whiteboards to create an enriching classroom learning environment. The white boards we have currently are ones that I have made. They are white construction paper put into a see-through sleeve. These homemade whiteboards are very flimsy and do not last long. If our class has the hard-back whiteboards, they would last for a very long time and we would be able to practice standards and skills learned throughout the day. Students will use the lined side of the whiteboard to practice writing words or short responses. Students will use the blank side to brainstorm or complete mathematical equations. These whiteboards will ensure that all students are actively learning and participating in whole group lessons as well as practicing during their independent time. Please help us get our whiteboards! I can assure you that this would be an educational tool that would get its use in our classroom. My students this year and many years to come will utilize them daily.
needStatement: My students need 35 Double-Sided whiteboards.

name: Technology to Keep Our Bodies and Minds Healthy!
description: Nelson Mandela said, 'Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.' As a teacher I want my 4th graders to believe, like Nelson Mandela, that they can change the world! Having more technology in our class will aide them to achieve this. My fourth graders attend a charter school in central Florida. They are excited to learn and love to research and use computers to further their knowledge on multiple topics. They enjoy laughing, singing, and dancing. I try to incorporate music into their instruction to get them moving and to learn in more innovating ways. They also are more engaged when instruction is hands on and they are involved in a more physical way. Having a Chromebook and wireless mouse will put more technology in our classroom. The students can utilize this technology to create PowerPoint presentations, make movies, research information for projects, and use multiple math, reading, science, and social studies games and web-based instruction. The students can create music with movements on days when P.E. is inside due to inclement weather, and can research other ways to keep moving and stimulate their minds and their bodies! Having more technology in the classroom will allow more students to have access to all that the Internet offers. Each student can enhance their education by using and implementing ways to incorporate the use of computers across all their subjects and instruction. Their ideas of how to use this are limitless.
needStatement: My students need a Chromebook and wireless mouse to advance their education and to utilize technology in profound ways.

name: Classroom Camera to Capture Kindergarten Moments
description: Everyday we are making memories that will last a lifetime. Whether it's learning the fundamentals of reading, creating a sturdy structure from blocks, or even Skyping with a real NASA scientist, we want to be able to capture these moments. My students are an amazing group of kindergarteners. Everyday they come to school excited to learn and participate in all of our fun/educational activities. We are an ESTEEM (ethics, science, technology, engineering, entrepreneurs, and mathematics) school. This means that in addition to the regular academics, we have additional activities like NASA Friday (when we learn about our solar system), a kindergarten garden, and Steminars (when we have an elective to learn more about science or technology). Having students this excited about learning makes everyday an awesome experience! My students will benefit from this classroom camera because they will have pictures of their own to keep and remember all these activities. I often want to take pictures of special events and do not have a camera handy. Having one in the classroom will help eliminate that problem. I will be able to take pictures of the different stages of our garden and take pictures of them participating in our many activities. I will then be able to upload them directly to the classroom computer and print pictures to go into their kindergarten portfolios! Having this classroom camera will give my students pictures to remember many of the kindergarten activities that we do every day all year long. My students and their families will be able to appreciate the pictures both immediately and in the years to come.
needStatement: My students need a classroom camera with storage case to capture all of our amazing kindergarten memories.

name: New Supplies for the New Year!
description: When it is time to illustrate the setting of a particular story, first grade students in Room 109 will happily set to work using brand new pencils and crayons. rather than their current supplies which have become rag-tag, broken, and worn. Help these students ring in 2014 with new school supplies! Doerfler Elementary is a K-8 school located in inner-city Milwaukee. 100% of my students qualify for free and reduced lunch. The population of my school is multi-ethnic, drawing largely from the Hispanic neighborhood in which it resides. My first grade students have shown such an enthusiasm for learning to read. These young readers take pride in their abilities and work together to support each other in this common endeavor. Every day students in my classroom gather up their materials and work through their literacy stations during reading time. When I am working with small groups, the others are working in groups and independently. To do this, they need basic supplies such as pencils, folders, coloring materials, and at times, scissors. With new pencil boxes packed with their pencils, crayons, and a pair of scissors, each student will be equipped to work with independence on learning their focus words of the week, engaging in spelling activities, or writing independently. These new materials will enable my students to succeed in their literacy stations as well as support their academic endeavors all day long. Every student deserves access to basic quality materials. Not only will my students learn academics, they will also learn to care for these new materials with a sense of responsibility and ownership of new supplies. My students have proven over the past several months that they can be great stewards of our classroom and the materials I have provided. Now it is time for them to take care of their own supplies.
needStatement: My students need to replenish their basic school supplies. They are in need of new pencils, crayons, pencil boxes, and scissors.

name: White Board for Hands-On Student Learning
description: How do you engage young students so that they participate in writing, note taking, and peer learning? A dry erase white board allowing students to write their ideas for all to see is one way to motivate our young learners. I teach bright highly motivated first grade students in a New York City public school. We live in the borough of Queens, a part of our nation that enjoys a deserved reputation for diversity. Our school community is an international one and we share the rich heritage of many cultures. With that diversity and global perspective comes expectations to bring the best resources and education possible to young children who seek to achieve academic success. Our young parents are keenly aware of new ways of learning and the power of interactivity in that process. We know that learning from peers is an integral part of the acquisition of knowledge and sometimes simple tools can go far to achieve that goal. Our families are our partners in learning and support us in ways that include class visits to celebrate student work. I have seen the excitement students have in putting their work on the blackboard in the front of the room. I have also discovered that as we move around, students are eager to share their work but need something portable on which to write. The dry erase board is a simple tool that requires no technological expertise yet it encourages students who work in groups to share by simply writing or drawing their ideas. I have requested a dry erase board that is 4 feet by 6 feet so it is large enough for a group to post ideas yet small enough to be portable. This dry erase board can be moved with ease around the room, has a stand, is relatively light, and can even be propped up against the blackboard in the front of the room. This is a low tech solution to increasing interactivity, motivating student participation that enhances engagement. I have also requested different colored dry erase markers for students to use. Students love to write on a board (usually a blackboard) and this dry erase board gives us the opportunity to write anywhere in the room, as groups convene for independent work. This board doesn't require electrical power or special training to use, is dust free, and and can encourage student participation as the children write their ideas for all to see. The board would be so convenient and useful for our students, and we'd see the work so much more easily. Thank you for your support.
needStatement: My students need a whiteboard so that they can share their work using dry erase markers and move the board to various locations in the room for small group work.

name: Math Mania Madness
description: A typical day in my classroom includes children talking, learning, sharing, smiling, and asking, 'Can we do more math?' My answer is always yes but I could sure use some help finding more math games and manipulatives. Our school is the home of the 'Soaring Eagles'! Our entire staff is committed to providing a safe and inviting learning environment. Our goal is to develop students who are critical thinkers, problem solvers, and risk takers. We believe that our partnership with parents and families in providing the best educational experience for all students is a key component to our success. We are honored to have the opportunity to serve those who have been entrusted to us. My students are curious and willing to try anything at least ONCE I teach math conceptually not procedurally. Procedural involves working out a procedure, but the students may not understand the reasoning behind a procedure. Conceptual knowledge is understanding the concepts in order to solve problems (so students may use any procedure). In order to do this I need manipulatives so that my students can construct their own knowledge. The games and math packs I have chosen will be used in my 'guided math' lessons. I will teach a mini-lesson to the entire class and then they will rotate around the room to learn more about that concept through collaboration and teamwork. The different games and math packs will be set up each day so that my students can practice their skills and learn to articulate what they have learned to their classmates. I will rotate the stations each week so that they will be fresh and new. I hope to have these supplies very soon so that I can continue to provide high-quality, fun math instruction in my classroom. If you feel so inclined, I would love to take you on this journey with us. My students will be ever so grateful and will be thrilled to send you thank you notes.
needStatement: My students need the many wonderful math games, learning centers and match-up activities to help them love math even more.

name: Listening and Reading Centers
description: My students love reading, but many of them are still struggling with reading independently. We work hard every day to help improve our reading skills while having fun. It's my goal that I will be able to help my students develop a love for reading just like my teachers did for me. I teach first grade at a school with a very diverse population. We have students from all different backgrounds with very different home lives. My school is located in an area where most of the families do not have much money, and often barely have enough money to cover their basic needs. My school is a choice school in our district so parents from any part of the district can choose to send their students to our school. The families here want only the best for their child and work hard to help their children to succeed in school even if they have limited time, money or even English speaking skills at home. The listening center will be allow small groups of students to listen to a story and follow along with the reader in their book. After the story they will be able listen to questions and check their comprehension of the stories even if they are still working on becoming independent readers. Having this listening center will allow one more center in my classroom so I can have smaller groups to work with and give students more personalized help during their time working with me each day. The whisper phones will be used when students are practicing letter sounds and decodable reader books. It can become very noisy with students reading to themselves, but these whisper phones will allow them to whisper their words and still hear themselves saying it without distracting others in their group or the entire class. These items will help my students become strong independent readers and listeners. These items will provide my students with more opportunities to explore reading and listening independently and finish first grade confident in their reading skills and be ready for second grade next year.
needStatement: My students need listening and reading center materials to help them improve reading fluency, comprehension and accuracy.

name: Getting Active: Taking Steps To Being Active & Fit Part 2
description: Childhood obesity is a national problem that I would like to address with my students. Our students need to exercise more, and these pedometers will let the students see how active they are or are not. I teach at a wonderful Title I elementary school in Northern California. The school population is mostly lower-middle class families. Approximately fifty percent of our students are English language learners with academic abilities ranging from GATE to special needs. Unfortunately many of my students do not participate in any after school physical activities. I would like to model with my students where we all use pedometers for at least one week straight, hopefully longer. The children will record their daily steps total, as well as a class daily total. I will also post my daily step totals. We will also be recording our daily food intake for at least one week, with the encouragement to eat only healthy foods. I am hoping that the children will be motivated to continue to exercise and eat healthy after this Healthy Science Living Unit is complete. They will continue to use the pedometers after this science unit is complete if they want to continue to monitor their daily walking / steps. These pedometers will be part of math & science lessons. My students need to get active, and I hope these material are the first step to learning to exercise more and eat healthy foods. Help my students try to take their first STEPS towards learning to have healthy lifestyles while they are getting active. These pedometers will be used for future students as well. I am looking forward to getting these students to take their steps towards healthy lifestyles! Help them to start making changes for the better for their lifestyles.
needStatement: My students need Fitbit pedometers to start getting active and taking more steps everyday.

name: Projectors Bring Learning To Life!
description: My students come to school everyday ready to learn. Many of my lessons are on the computer, and need to be seen with the use of a projector. The problem I have, is my projector is older than most of my students! About 98% of my students are second language learners or ELLs. ELL means English language learner. English is not their native language, and learning English can be hard for them. The area in which my school is located is an area of poverty where parents are always working and cannot afford school supplies. All students receive free lunch. With this in mind, I cannot ask for donations from families because I will not receive any. With the new Projector, I will be able to use the new Elmo that we received more efficiently. Students will be able to see everything. The projector that we currently have-does not always work, and it would like to retire. It is especially important for my ELD students that need step-by-step instructions delivered visually. My project is important because my students aspire to do well in school. They dream big and have others believe in them along the way. My students need to understand math, and the best way to help them achieve this is to give them materials to use to learn math and science!
needStatement: My students need a new projector!

name: Numerous Nice Students have Nothing in Non-Fiction!
description: Do you remember the first time you had to stand in front of a classroom and give an oral report? I would love to help my students whom are diagnosed with special needs conquer their fears of public speaking. Giving them a topic that they and their audience find fascinating makes the task easier. My students include students who are diagnosed with speech and language impairment, learning disabled, autistic, and emotionally disturbed. All of my students are registered for Title One services in an urban school in New York City. I would like to present my students with lessons using special hands-on materials, student choice built into the challenging curriculum, and the ability for students to work at their own level. My students are in the amazing world of second and third grade where learning requires a lot of hands-on activities! My students love science and get excited about interesting and odd things. They all come with amazing and different personalities. Our school is very close-nit and small, but we can make a huge impact! These resources, including a bugs kit, informational texts, and a plant lab, will enable my students to fully care for, observe, evaluate and research butterflies and plants that they find compelling and fascinating. The students will prepare a report on their butterfly/plant and share their findings in an oral presentation before their classmates and parents. Parents will be encouraged to assist their child in preparing their report and to practice the oral report. Each student's presentation and report will be evaluated using a rubric reflecting common Core Standards in the areas of speaking and listening. This project will give them the hands-on materials they need to experiment with the things they are learning about in Science. The materials will be placed in their non-fiction center where they can experiment with each one. Research supports the notion that anyone can greatly reduce their fears of public speaking through a series of presenting 22 or more oral presentation sessions. These materials will make a difference in the lives of my students because it will give them the opportunity to truly experiment with things they are learning about which will cultivate a curiosity and love of learning in them. These students may truly be the ones who grow up and make an amazing discovery, find the cure for cancer, or become a great leader!
needStatement: My students need a bugs kit, informational texts, and a plant lab to help enhance their learning.

name: Sharp Pencils, Sharp Minds
description: Imagine being in the middle of an awesome essay. Your ideas are flowing...and then your pencil lead breaks. No problem, right? Just go sharpen it. But the teacher's ancient pencil sharpener won't sharpen evenly. A heavy duty electric pencil sharpener could easily solve this problem. I teach 110 awesome seventh grade English students. We spend a large percentage of our time writing about literature, current events, and the crazy events that make up their lives. Our transition to common core has increased the amount of time that we spend writing. After our school experienced a devastating tornado on May 20, we have been fortunate to receive donations of pencils and paper to last throughout the year. One item that would help significantly is an electric pencil sharpener. It would allow students to quickly and efficiently sharpen their pencils and return to work. A heavy duty electric pencil sharpener placed in the front of the classroom will allow students to sharpen their pencils as soon as they enter the room so that they can begin working as soon as class starts. It will be convenient for use anytime during class as well. Electric pencil sharpeners sharpen more quickly and accurately than the old sharpeners that we already use. Their sharp pencils will help their brilliant ideas flow onto their paper! We have an old crank-style pencil sharpener and a couple of dozen handheld pencil sharpeners, but the addition of an electric pencil sharpener would cut down on the number of times that students needed to get up out of their seats, therefore allowing them to spend more time on task. Also, a sharp pencil makes the students feel like he or she is doing the best work possible!
needStatement: My students need an electric pencil sharpener to keep their pencils sharp while they write amazing essays.

name: Organized and Ready to Learn!
description: My students love school, but haven't mastered the fine art of organization yet. Since my kindergarteners work at large tables, they don't have a place to store supplies and workbooks at their work areas. Our school is in the 2nd largest, urban school district in New Jersey. Over the past few years, our budget for materials, like the ones I am requesting, have dwindled and now no longer exist. These materials will help my students become organized and help to cut down on distractions and wasted time passing out materials during our day. These seat sacks will be used on individual chairs in the classroom. They will store notebooks, folders, pencil cases and workbooks. This will allow my students to have a clean, less distracting work area and teach them responsibility and organization. This will allow my students to have a clean, less distracting work area and teach them responsibility and organization. These materials will cut down on valuable learning time that is wasted passing out materials. It will also eliminate the distraction of having materials in front of the students on their tables.
needStatement: My students need 28 individual seat sacks for their chairs to keep educational materials and workbooks located in an area for quick access.

name: Help Our School Buy An Instrument - Saxophone
description: When my students pick up an instrument for the first time, they have no idea where it will take them or the joy playing will bring them. They're just excited to try something new. We are an urban school in Minnesota with bright, creative students. We have a rapidly expanding band program. If the rate of growth keeps up, I will not be able to get instruments to all the students who want to join band next year. I have been acquiring instruments in every way I can, but even with the used instruments I've been able to acquire, I haven't been able to keep up with the need for instruments among students who couldn't otherwise afford to rent or buy one from a music store. This instrument will not only give many students an enriching opportunity to learn to play saxophone, it will give them a chance to identify as musicians. Playing this saxophone could give a student who might struggle in other academic areas a chance to shine. Making music is special. Studies have shown a link between reading and math scores and making music. This project will bring a quality saxophone into my classroom and into the hands of a student who wouldn't otherwise be able to afford this experience. Please help me create an amazing experience for my students.
needStatement: My students need a saxophone to help support a rapidly expanding band program.

name: Dragons On Fire To Read!
description: Remember the days of playing house, slaying dragons and wandering the backyard looking for treasures? I encourage my students to find those books that stimulate and create a desire to read daily. Let's give them the resources that continue to draw my dragons in and keep the fire for reading alive! The imagination of my students and the information they share about the books they read, drive me to give them rich and equitable resources to engage them in reading. Their eyes light up with excitement when they are taught about specific authors, genres, readers theaters and are able to debate current issues and topics through reading. My students come from diverse backgrounds and most do not have a libraries at home. I often allow them to take books from our classroom library to ensure they are carrying the love of reading home. My adorable dragons continue to excel and grow through reading. This is only one way I can continue to help them thrive and grow. I cannot even begin to express what 'Storyworks' will allow me to integrate in the classroom, or the benefits it will bestow upon my students, but I will give it my best shot. As we have rolled out Common Core Standards, it has been challenging to find resources and text to support our lessons. As I stumbled upon a copy of 'Storyworks,' it has enhanced my teaching significantly. I am able to teach complex text in a wide range of genres, share thrilling narrative non-fiction text, original fiction, bring historical events to life through readers theater, explore classic and contemporary poetry, as well as support each one of my students at their individual levels. The best part of 'Storyworks' is I am able to allow my students to take them home and share them with their family and loved ones. This request is not only for my own personal classroom but that of my grade level. I desire to let my passion for reading to infiltrate as many as you will allow.
needStatement: My students need complex texts, in a wide range of genres, to achieve important language arts objectives that align with our common core curriculum.

name: Lego Robotics Kit
description: 'When I was seven, I taped a fork to a drill. It had a profound effect on me. It sounds silly, but I thought, 'Okay, the way the world works can be changed.'' Jay Silver We want our students, who are learning about how the world works, to understand that their ideas can bring about powerful change. We live in a community with a mixture of low-economic families and middle-class families. Many students have limited English, but they work very hard. Their parents are very supportive and work with their children to ensure success in school. Our students are bright and motivated. They enjoy learning about and using new technology. They amaze us with their ideas and willingness to persevere when faced with a problem. Our students have been creating products digitally, and we are ready to go to the next level and use the skills they have learned to have an object come to life. We think the best way to get started is with the Lego Robotics kit. Students will then be able to design and create a robot of any style and with any function. Seeing their designs come to life will allow our students to experience a true 21st century classroom. The skills students will acquire by learning to use a true robotics kit will help them throughout their school career and into the workforce. We want to provide an environment where creative ideas can be nurtured and developed and the students' ideas can come to life. Our students have brilliant ideas. They just need the technology to implement them. Who knows....it just might change the world!
needStatement: My students need a Lego Robotics kit to advance their science, technology, engineering, and math skills.

name: Busy Minds Need A Rest
description: I have 15 students that attend my preschool full day class. It is mandatory in our state approved curriculum that the children receive at least an hour nap. I would like for my students to sleep on cots that are not worn by years of use. New cots would provide better comfort for the children. My preschool class consists of 3 and 4 year old children. My students are very eager to learn and are very energetic. My school is located in the inner city. The Early Childhood department of my district has made great efforts to supply every child within this city the opportunity to a highly qualified free preschool education. The children will use the requested materials during nap time. The children will each have an individual cot placed around our classroom for them to rest on before the afternoon session begins. This will give the children a chance to 'reboot' before continuing with the rest of our day. My project will make a difference because the children will have a clean, sturdy, and comfortable place to rest. This will allow the students to continue with the rest of their day with a heightened energy level which will cause them to be more attentive, alert, and focused on learning.
needStatement: My students need 15 new cots because the cots that we are currently using are several years old and are worn. This is a full day preschool class.

name: Help Us Finish The Year With Supplies
description: We are a culture that is obsessed with technology! While we love our gadgets; however, basic school supplies make all of the difference in the world in classrooms. Without them, very little can affectively be accomplished. I teach in a school where more than 90% of the students are from low income households. Many of them meet the financial criteria for being classified 'living in poverty.' Many don't get the opportunity to bring supplies to school. Their parents often have to make the choice between paying bills, or buying supplies...buying groceries, or buying supplies. As a result, I try to stand in the gap as much as possible, purchasing basic supplies whenever I can. As the prices increase from year to year, this becomes more challenging for me. The rest of our fifth grade year will be spent preparing for junior high school. I have spent months stressing the importance of organization! The folders will help us to organize our materials for Math, Social Studies, and Writing class and prevent daily assignments from becoming lost in a sea of papers inside of their cubbies. Our beginning of the year folders have finally seen their last days! With new folders, students will be able to keep things neatly in one spot, instead of shuffling through piles of assignments in their cubbies which becomes disruptive and wastes a lot of class time. In addition to the folders, we are asking for notebooks, tabs to organize our notebooks, pens, and highlighters. My fifth graders are in the early stages of annotating text and notetaking. This, we know, is an important skill they will need throughout the rest of their education. Finally, we are asking for scissors to help us complete classroom projects. We currently share 8 pairs of scissors! Your donations will help us successfully complete our 5th grade year. As spring approaches, this is not the time for us to become lax in our classroom, but time for us to prepare for the next phase of their education. Your help would be greatly appreciated!
needStatement: My students need file folders, Post-It tabs, pens, and scissors with a scissor caddy to help us finish the school year.

name: Vices for Metals
description: Welcome to Mr. T's shop. My goal is to give my 7th and 8th grade students a knowledge and skill base that they can build on for the rest of their lives. With less than 60 days with each group of students, there is a lot to do in a very short time. I've got some of the best students in the world. We live in a rural Idaho community that still values 'vocational' education. My students are interested in learning skills they can use in their daily lives- possibly even for making a living. We have about 600 students in a 7th and 8th grade only building. I get to see on average 100 of them each trimester. Students will be mainly using these vices to make me deaf. Okay, not really. Vices are an essential tool in any shop- holding pieces to be cut, pressing bits together, hammering on the anvil, bending, the list could go on for miles. We mainly use these vices in my metals class- where I teach them how to punch holes in metal, set rivets, groove seams, and straighten projects that might have gotten a little off kilter. How will this make a difference? Well, It will let my students DOUBLE their productivity. Instead of 20 students in 2 lines waiting for a vise, I'll have 20 students in 4 lines waiting. They'll be a lot happier because they can actually get stuff done, and as a class they will have more time to go bigger with their projects!
needStatement: My students need vices! 2 of our 4 vices literally fell to pieces this year. The remaining 2 are shared between 20+ students. This really slows us down in the shop.

name: iPads For Pre-K? Yes We Can!
description: Children learn best by building from simple to complex concepts, from two-dimensional to three-dimensional worlds. Multi-touch mobile devices bring the world to our fingertips! The iPad has many uses: books, videos, handwriting, math, researching, learning keyboard skills, etc.,and the list goes on. My students are eager to learn young children. The majority of the children in my class are from low-income families. My goal is to provide them the opportunity to explore all technology in our world. With the wave of education changing toward technology, and tests which will soon be given online, children need to be exposed to technology as soon as possible. The children in my class attend a small rural school in Oklahoma, many of which are farm children or Native American children whose technology exposure may be limited. The iPad I am requesting will change not only my students' lives forever, but also their future teachers' lives. The iPad's will boost the children's education and put them ahead of the game in today's rigorous curriculum. We will be able to use the iPad's on a daily basis during centers, Math, and Literacy. During centers the opportunities are endless, whether it be a nursery rhyme center, listening center, math, or language. No matter the subject or skill I will be able to customize the iPad to provide the learning opportunity. I will also be able to customize it even further and challenge each child individually to his/her specific need. During whole group instruction I can use the app that puts the iPad screen onto our SmartBoard so everyone can see and interact together. Technology is and will be a part of the children's lives. Please help my students develop the skills needed to become active learners in a high paced technological world. The iPads are a definite tool that will help them with future learning as they move along their educational paths.
needStatement: My students need one more iPad Mini to complete a 'set' to be used during center work.

name: Pregnancy Prevention
description: 'Human behavior flows from three main sources: desire, emotion, and knowledge.' - PLATO I believe that if I give my students the knowledge, they can make informed decisions and have the desire to succeed. We are an urban school district with a high graduation and college acceptance rate. Our courses address core knowledge requirements for state exams, but also challenge students to develop their writing and critical thinking skills. Furthermore, our Senior Option program allows eligible high school seniors the opportunity to engage in community service, internship, employment programs, or take undergraduate coursework at partnering colleges. Each student will take a Baby home on a rotation basis for the weekend. They will learn how hard it is to care for an infant as a teenager and the demands an infant will have. The simulation baby makes it possible for people to practice caring for an infant 24 hours a day, 3 days a week. Babies cry for care at all hours, day and night. The caregiver determines what the Baby needs: feeding, burping, rocking, diapering. Also, the Baby's computer tracks it's care and safe handling, and provides the teacher with a detailed assessment that is downloaded post-simulation. The donations will help us expand our health curriculum and give our students a real-life and hands-on experience. I believe that with this extensive curriculum, the students will have a better understanding about how becoming a teenage parent can impact their future.
needStatement: My students need 4 simulation babies to help aid in our Health Education to reduce our pregnancies within the school.

name: Help Us Shape Up!
description: Our classroom is full of energy and love for life! We like to move, work in small groups, and have great conversations. My students love fun but also know how to work hard. They are challenged all the time because challenge fosters growth! A quote on our wall reminds us: 'We can do hard things!' My students are very enthusiastic about learning! We love our charter school in rural Idaho. The atmosphere is very warm and friendly. We are able to work in small groups right at each students' level. Our school is known as a 'safe place' for each and every student. We love the diversity and unique perspective of each student. Our discussions are engaging and enriching because we learn from each other. My students have struggles, but they don't let that stop them! Often we make our own supplies or make due with what we can find. We have used rocks and buttons to do multiplication. We used straws and candy for fractions. These things work great, but there are some resources that are difficult and time consuming to make! We could really use some help! My students will begin with a pile of pattern shapes. They will discover different ways to sort them and share their ideas with the class. Then they will learn the names of shapes by saying them aloud as they toss shape beanbags back and forth. Next, we will learn about quadrilaterals. They will get to make their own on a geoboard. After that they will have new ideas for sorting, and can return to the pattern blocks to put their ideas to use! With the clay they will be able to create shapes. I can quiz them, and they can quiz each other. These concepts will be real to them as they touch and see each shape, as they hear the names while they move, and as they create which lets them feel ownership of each shape. Because their learning is based in their world, it will stay with them. They will look back and remember experiences rather than a foreign idea simply told to them. First of all, my students will love you if you donate! They are so excited. I told them that the resources may not come in time for them to use them, but they would be their for my future classes, and they were still excited! This is how amazing my students are! I wish that you could just see a glimpse of the trials some of my students face. I am always impressed with their resilience and attitude. I am doing everything I possibly can for them because they deserve it. I hope that you will too!
needStatement: My students need shapes for geometry! They would love to learn names of shapes with beanbags, sort shapes with pattern blocks, and create shapes with clay and geoboards.

name: Classroom Supplies
description: Staying organized makes learning easier. If my students could keep their desks more organized, they would be able to find things faster and use up less learning time. We will use the pocket chart daily to vote or show our favorite items. It will be a quick math lesson every day! My students are wonderful! We are a low poverty city school with high spirits! As wonderful as they all are, they could really use some organization to help improve our daily routines! Which is why I would like each students to have a pencil box. They will get to label it with their name and keep all their wonderful learning tools inside it. Every morning I will have a different thing for the students to chart on the pocket chart. For example they may chart their favorite sports or colors. The sharpener will join my writing area so my students don't have to use up time with handheld sharpeners. The multi colored markers will also help us with charting as well as illustrating items on the white board. The pencil boxes are going to help my students stay organized. The more we are organized the more time we can spend learning! The less time we can use up on things like sharpening pencils and getting things from our desk (pencil, scissors, markers, etc.) the more time we can spend learning! The pocket chart will give us a fun mini lesson, different every day!
needStatement: My students need pencil boxes, a pencil sharpener, and other supplies to help improve our daily routines and learning experiences!

name: Graphic Novels for English Language Learners
description: I'm trying to transform my classroom into an environment where books are treasured. My ELL students, who struggle with reading, need to feel successful as readers. It's a challenge to find the right books for them. Graphic novels are the perfect fit for them because the pictures help them understand. My students are English Language leaners who come from low-income homes. Many of them do not have access to books in their homes. The majority of students in my classroom are reading below grade level. Most of their parents speak only Spanish, so it is hard for them to get support and help with reading at home. This year they have come so far as readers. Every day we work to instill a love for books and reading. Through booktalks and read alouds my students are getting more and more excited about reading. My students read independently every day. They are able to choose their own books, and most of my students gravitate towards graphic novels. These books engage them because the picture support helps them with their comprehension. Graphic novels are especially helpful for my reluctant boys readers. They can't get enough of graphic novels. I love watching these boys read graphic novels because they are finally able to feel successful as readers. We need these books in our classroom so that my students' love of reading can continue to grow. This donation will enable me to keep putting great books into the hands of my students. Our school library does not have many graphic novels, and the ones we do have are always checked out. By having graphic novels in my own classroom, I'll be able to help my students feel successful as readers. Seeing them enjoy reading is my greatest joy as an educator. Reading these books will keep my students engaged in reading. They are building great habits that I hope they continue throughout their lives.
needStatement: My students need graphic novels because the picture support helps them understand the story. Reading graphic novels keeps them engaged and makes them feel successful.

name: Our Students Want to Become Global Citizens!
description: At our school, we have formed a fantastic new initiative called Kids and Culture. We offer tutoring services and a rigorous program that culminates in a study tour abroad. Our students have never been given even the opportunity to leave their hometown! In just a few years, our program has given students the opportunity to explore the world. They spend the months before conducting independent research on a specific country under the guidance of college advisers from multiple participating universities. The work produced is extremely high level, but more importantly, their investment in their studies has never been higher. The students are asking questions and seeking out information on a culture they previously new little about. Right in front of our eyes, we are forming a new generation of global citizens. This authentic form of learning has long been reserved for those who are financially stable. Despite the fact that our students come from low income neighborhoods, they manage to prove how high achieving they truly are. The growth in their maturity is matched by their new sense of determination to further explore the world and make their own lasting impression. The success of this program is epitomized in their final research projects that not only are factual, but have a personal element to them as they implement personal accounts of what they saw and studied on their tour. The students incorporate their own photos, video journals, and narratives while tackling critical problems like water filtration, the global economy, or religious uprisings and the governments level of involvement. A dedicated group of students will be traveling through Spain and Portugal. Here they will gain first hand experience as they study the previously resilient military, compare the education system with that of our own, and practice their new formed language skills that they have learned prior to arrival. They will volunteer and give back to the local communities by visiting a local school and even have a cooking class! You have the power to make this impossible dream a reality for students.
needStatement: My students need the chance to participate on a study tour of Spain and Portugal with the Kids n Culture program.

name: Reading with Meaning...Let's Take A Closer Look!
description: 'Reading without reflecting is like eating without digesting'. Edmund Burke said it best! Working at a Title I school comes with several challenges. Over half of my third-graders are on free or reduced lunch. Two-thirds come from homes where Spanish is the primary language. It's no surprise that so many of them struggle with comprehension. By the time students enter my classroom, most of them have learned to read fluently, but have little comprehension. Reading without meaning is a recurring problem year after year. With this project, I hope to be able to set up small learning centers that will allow my students to practice comprehension skills in a variety of ways. I hope to show them how to take small chunks of high-interest text and carefully examine each piece. My students will learn how to utilize graphic organizers to find the evidence that supports their answers. With the activities funded through this project, I hope to bring meaning to my students' reading. I want to show them that there is a purpose with all reading we do, whether it be learning new information or for pure entertainment. I hope to create life long readers!
needStatement: My students need small center activities such as the Boost Comprehension Small-Group Teaching Center, Close Reading Comprehension Center, What's the Point? Comparing Text Center and the Common Core Daily Language Practice Center to improve comprehension.

name: Wiggle Less, Learn More!
description: My students walk into an organized room full of color each morning. They know they are loved, appreciated, but they also know they are to always do their best. However, many students struggle to focus with all the energy they have built up each day. I constantly try to find new ways to get my kids active in their learning. We complete kinesthetic activities daily. We work with our peers. We dance. We sing. We chant. We do everything we can to make our learning energizing. However, we still have so much built up, unused, bubbling energy! With the ball chairs, my students will be able to release all that built up energy in a quiet, distraction free way. Research shows that by allowing students with ADD or ADHD to release their penned up energy with some small movement throughout the day, they will focus more on their studies, learn more, become more successful, and be less distracting to their peers. This even helps them in social settings. Less distractions for peers means better friendships for my students. Not only will we be building better life long learners, we will continue to build better friends, both of which are essential to life! My students will be overwhelmed with their new focus abilities, with a simple change like switching from hard, boring chairs to bright, energy releasing ball chairs. They will be thrilled with all the new success they will finally be able to achieve!
needStatement: My students need 18 ball chairs to help them focus more on their studies by allowing an outlet for excess energy.

name: Graphic Novels Make Readers Out Of Reluctants
description: What was the first book you read from start to finish? By fifth grade some students still have not had that experience. Let's help put that just right book in their hands by providing lots of high-interest stories including comic books. My fifth graders range from voracious readers to those who bitterly refuse to pick up a book because they think they do not like reading. Both kinds of students and all in between deserve to be exposed to a wide variety of reading material. For some children comic books are the only thing that will engage them. Comic books or graphic novels can be a foot in the door for many and can be the beginning of a beautiful reading life. I have requested a great variety of graphic novels. My students will be able to pick up these new and unfamiliar books amongst all the old second hand ones I have picked up over the years. These new books would renew their enthusiasm for reading. My students create book reviews to share with the class. Adding to our collection of books would give them something new to talk about with their reading partner and the class. You will absolutely change my students lives if you help us. How? Donalyn Miller says it best, 'ÂÂReading unlocks worlds unknown or forgotten, taking travelers around the world and through time. Reading helps you escape the confines of school and pursue your own education. Through characters,ÂÂ' the saints and the sinners, real or imagined,ÂÂ' reading shows you how to be a better human being.'
needStatement: My students need a larger variety of engaging stories for our classroom library.

name: Physics Supplies - Making Progress After Hurricane Sandy!
description: My students live in one of the most challenged urban areas in New Jersey. They come to school with hopes and ambitions to learn and build a better future! Living in neighborhoods filled with gang violence, my students attend school to improve their chances for future success. Their hopes and dreams are the same as children from other walks of life. Unfortunately the resources in our 100+ year old school are severely lacking. Through amazing people like you, we have been fortunate enough to replace some of our science supplies lost to Hurricane Sandy. However, there is still a long way to go. The CPO Colliding Pendulum Module set, 3 CPO Physics Stands, and supply of pencils requested through this project will offer my students a wonderful opportunity to receive hands-on learning in critical areas of physics. In order to allow concepts to become internalized, most students need to physically witness and manipulate the lab materials. The CPO stands will allow us to utilize the Colliding Pendulum kits as we study Momentum. It truly is amazing to watch their faces as they travel the road to scientific discovery! It enhances their desire to further their knowledge of Physics! You can make a direct positive impact in my students' lives by donating to this project. The challenging road to college will be made a potential reality for many of these underprivileged students... thanks to you!
needStatement: My students need 1 classroom set of CPO Colliding Pendulum modules, CPO Physics Stands, and pencils.

name: FM Unit for ADHD
description: For many of my students, they are able to focus for an extended period of time. Having a fm unit in the classroom will help the student focus and limit less distractions in the classroom. I am a teacher who works in a low socioeconomic district that has many problems getting students to engage in their schoolwork or to take pride in their accomplishments. Many of our children love to learn, but some do not have the same passion to learn. Everyday is a challenge and would to be easier with having the proper materials available. Your donation can make a difference in our classroom. For most of my children, the tapping of a pencil or a student talking is a smallest enough of a distraction that results in their off task behavior. Research has proven that using a FM unit in the classroom leads to better focus and less of a distraction for students who have a distractibility issues. The students would use the headphones while learning on the computers to eliminate distractions. Many of my students aren't given the best opportunities in life, but with your donation, you can help broaden my students' knowledge of being successful in whatever they do! You can be the change that one of my students needs in order to be successful in school as well life. Each child needs an inspiration, and you could be the one who changes a life forever.
needStatement: My students need a Motiva Personal FM unit and 10 headphones to assist to blocking out distractions in the classroom.

name: Pencils, Highlighters, And Paper, Oh, My!
description: My students are in desperate need of simple classroom supplies! Many of my students live in poverty. They will have supplies at the beginning of the school year, but by the end those supplies are long gone. Their parents are unable to supply these basic items for them. I try to keep up a stash of things such as pens, pencils, and erasers; however my supplies are dwindling as well! My students need pens and pencils so they can participate in class. The students will use my materials when they do not have materials of their own. It is expected that my students come to class prepared, however I must keep in mind the fact that most of my students are unable to get these things for themselves. I will ask that the students return my things at the end of the school day. My project will make a difference, because in order for students to learn, they have to be comfortable enough to learn. This includes meeting basic needs such as having pens, pencils, paper, erasers, etc.
needStatement: My students need pens and pencils and erasers so they can participate in class.

name: Ipads for 21st Century Learners
description: Have you ever sat in a classroom and the words of your 100 pound textbook seemed to transform into gibberish right before your eyes? Or the voice of your teacher turns into the monotonous tones of Charlie Brown's teacher? Anyone who has been a student can attest to this feeling. In the digital world, 21st century learners are struggling more than ever to stay engaged in a lesson. All you have to do is Google, 'kids attention span and technology,' and you will get a plethora of articles and studies arguing that the digital world we live in has desensitized children to heavy stimulation. I find myself working harder than ever to keep sound teaching practices engaging for my students. In addition, the majority of my students come from low socioeconomic backgrounds, their cultural and academic experiences diminish their confidence when it comes time to crack open the textbook or begin writing. Too often I see them mentally checked out before they even have to get started! In turn, they get frustrated and lose enthusiasm in what we're learning! Hand them an iPad, however, and no matter what you ask them to do, they are ready and motivated to take on whatever challenge you give them! With iPads, I can begin incorporating this interactive technology into my daily lessons. The options are endless. Individual students, who seriously struggle with motivation to read, can use the iPads to access the online textbook, which enhances the reading with videos and animated pictures. Students can work in collaborative groups to access my Prezis, digitally stimulating presentations, and take control of their own learning. With the Adobe Reader app, students can have directions, quizzes or other activities read to them. Quizlet will enable students to take assessments online and receive immediate feedback to maximize their learning. The iPads will engage, motivate and enable students to interact with their learning! By supporting this project you will enable my students to learn more deeply and in an exciting and memorable way. In addition to their learning, you will help my students gain confidence as learners and people as they see their curiosity and hard work turn into success.
needStatement: My students need 2 iPad minis with protective cases.

name: From Classroom to the Great Outdoors, Let's Move It!
description: 'Physical fitness is not only one of the most important keys to a healthy body, it is the basis of dynamic and creative intellectual activity.' ~John F. Kennedy. A powerful statement that empowers me to provide my students with fun and interactive ways to keep their minds bursting with knowledge. My students have bright smiles that light up the classroom despite their disabilities that range from moderate to severe diagnosis. Each day they are exposed to functional learning experiences that engage their minds and help them to understand the world they are living in. Our school community welcomes students with disabilities and promotes an inclusive setting. It is in these exclusive settings that my students are able to work with their same age peers and develop friendships. Physical Education is an important part of my students' fine and gross motor skills development. My students need more instructional time to master movement concepts and instruction needs to be engaging, creative, and fun! The target toss and comet balls are one of the ways my students can work on their motor skills. The activity mats, toss and catch play set, and balancing spoon game are also ways to promote skills development while also teaching them cooperative play. These hands-on active play resources will help my students gain the practice they need not only through the school year, but also while attending summer school. Additionally, my students will also be learning new vocabulary, practicing math skills, and learning some science concepts. By having these additional opportunities to learn these academic skills, my students will begin to generalize the concepts and learn that language, math, and science can be done outside while having fun in the sun! As a first year Special Education teacher, my goal is to provide my students with the necessary skills to learn at their individual levels, while introducing functional concepts. The best way to accomplish this is to provide a variety of learning opportunities in multiple learning modalities. That is why this project is important to me. Your donation will help me expand our functional curriculum to the outdoors and that will not only benefit my students this year, but in years to come. Thank-you.
needStatement: My students need balls, activity mats, balancing spoons, and game hoops to keep them active during summer school.

name: Needed: Pencils Sharpened Quietly!
description: Our class is full of energy and curiosity. Whether we are studying the events leading up to the American Revolution, animal adaptations (Cnidarians are the big topic right now), or poetry and writing, we all try to give it our best effort! Our class is 21 boys and girls, 3 of whom are English Language Learners, and another 3 have parents who do not speak English at home. Our class fits our school profile of 50% low income, qualifying half of our class for free lunches. Another 3 students receive special education services. The diversity is what makes this class wonderful challenge! Our school has 800 students and offers not only academic excellence to all, but wonderful opportunities such as 5th grade chorus and band, after-school clubs such as art and drama. We even have a club for kids to work with the animal shelter next door! My students need a quiet and reliable pencil sharpener. The one we have is so loud that it disrupts everything that is going on in the classroom. We also need 12 pairs of scissors! Our students will be able to use a pencil sharpener when they NEED to, and not have to wait until a lesson is over. Having a quiet and working pencil sharpener will insure that lessons can continue on without interruptions which can disrupt students' ability to stay focused on the lesson being taught. Having 12 more classroom scissors will allow projects to be completed more easily. These supplies seem simple but they will effect the classroom environment greatly. Having easy access to a quiet pencil sharpener will allow students to always have the pencil they need without being embarrassed to interrupt the class or having to wait until later. Having an adequate number of scissors in the room will make projects flow more easily.
needStatement: My students need a quiet and reliable pencil sharpener. The one we have is so loud that it disrupts everything that is going on in the classroom. We also need 12 pairs of scissors!

name: Ms. T.'s Class Needs a New Rug!!
description: Help us build a warm, inviting community with a big, new carpet for our center time! My fourth graders love to learn and enjoy helping each other learn as well! They are an energetic and eager group of kids. Having a new carpet will help us build this community and make center time more effective. This is my first year teaching and my class is amazing! They love helping each other learn, and we have all decided that having a bigger carpet will help us learn better. We are in public school in South Carolina and we represent a diverse student population. Many of my students are socioeconomically disadvantaged, and approximately 75% of the students at our school qualify for free or reduced lunch. My twenty-one fourth-grade students come from all different cultures and backgrounds. The lessons, activities, and center work that occur on the carpet area is a extremely important component to my students' learning experience. Carpet activities and centers help build a strong sense of teamwork and community. Students are able to spread out and help each other learn. Have a larger carpet will help my students have designated working areas where they can listen and work to the best of their abilities. Having this new carpet will help us save valuable time as students will know their expectations and will have room to learn, engage in lessons, and complete center work. This carpet will have a huge positive impact in our classroom. It will not only impact this school year, but school years to come! Time and energy will be saved as each student will have a place to learn and complete center activities. We can focus our attention on helping each teammate reach their highest potential. My students love learning. This carpet will make our community of learners stronger.
needStatement: My students need a new, larger rug for our classroom to meet on during center time. Centers are extremely important in fourth grade!!

name: Where in the World?
description: Our classroom is full of energy and love for life! We like to move, work in small groups, and have great conversations. My students love fun but also know how to work hard. They are challenged all the time because challenge fosters growth! A quote on our wall reminds us: 'We can do hard things!' My students are very enthusiastic about learning! We love our charter school in rural Idaho. The atmosphere is very warm and friendly. We are able to work in small groups, right at each student's level. Our school is known as a 'safe place' for each and every student. We, student's love the diversity and unique perspective of each student. Our discussions are engaging and enriching because we learn from each other. My students have struggles, but they don't let that stop them! Often we make our own supplies or make do with what we can find, but some things are impossible or too time consuming to make. We could really use some help! We will be learning about different habitats around the world. First, we will make books and do activities to learn about each habitat. As we do, we will be identifying different places where each of those habitats are located. This will give my students a better understanding of the beautiful world we live in. They will develop a wider perspective and take ownership of the earth. Next, we will explore our own habitat and discuss the importance of doing our part in taking care of our planet. Students will make use of the magnifying glasses as we explore plants, animals, soil, rocks, and more in the environment right around our school building. We will come up with ways we can improve the environment and make a commitment and a plan to do so! Students will gain a better understanding of our world and their part in it. I am excited for them to create, discuss, and explore. They will enjoy learning about the beauty of various habitats and how they are connected. As we 'travel' around the world, they will discover that each environment needs to be taken care of and protected. When we 'return' to our habitat, we will discover what we can do to take care of our environment and how doing just that, in effect, helps the world.
needStatement: My students need projects to learn about habitats, globes to locate habitats, and magnifying glasses to explore their habitat as part of their environmental education.

name: Technology for Tiny Fingers
description: Technology tools are kid magnets! An iPad in each kindergarten classroom would be extremely engaging for our youngest students. The iPad compliments all learning styles and can be used across all content areas. Our Elementary has four kindergarten sections of approximately 22 students a total of 76 kindergarteners. They are full of energy, enthusiasm, and a desire to learn! The goal of the grant is to use the iPads to improve student achievement across all populations. The touch screen facilitates easy use for tiny fingers still developing fine motor skills. The highly visual and animated delivery of iPad educational apps captures their imagination, motivates their desire to learn, and provides the authentic use of technology to master essential knowledge and skills. We are requesting three iPads. One of our teachers previously received an iPad through a grant. If this Donors Choose project is funded, the iPads will be placed permanently in each classroom. The use of the iPads will offer a plethora of appealing, hands-on learning experiences that will facilitate the mastery of kindergarten skills. The iPads will be utilized by independent student use in literacy and math stations. Students could use Tellagami, Videolicious, or Puppet Pals app to retell or create their own fairy tale. Another possibility would be to use Educreations app to describe the plant cycle or their animal research. Haiku Deck could be used to show their learning about landforms or science tools. The possibilities are endless! We want to provide a technology tool that will appeal to our 21st century learners, enhance instruction, and increase student learning. Growth with Developmental Reading Assessment (DRA) scores and math performance tasks scores will be indicators of the success of the iPads. The implementation of daily iPad use is aligned with purposeful, meaningful, and engaging learning opportunities directed toward mastering academic skills.
needStatement: My students need technology for tiny fingers! Three iPads would be extremely engaging for our youngest learners.

name: It's Time To Restock Our Scholastic Art Magazines
description: Remember how difficult it was in school to get through some of the text books? Did you find it much more interesting to pick up a magazine and read some short articles? I teach high school students who live in an extremely high poverty area. Most times the only magazines they have access to are the ones in our school library. However, many students rarely have time to make it to the library just for leisure reading. I try to keep some interesting art books and magazines on hand in the class room for them. They really seem to enjoy reading about artists and styles of art from short magazine articles. The student examples in the Scholastic Magazines seem to inspire them to try harder and learn more. Sadly, the magazines that I do have are mostly out dated hand me downs that are tattered and falling apart. My students need Scholastic Art Magazines for the 2014-2015 school year. The new subscription of Scholastic Art Magazine that we are asking for would be so motivating for my students. They are getting tired of seeing the same old magazines year after year. These new magazines would give my students some fresh, interesting information to learn. My hope is that it will inspire and encourage them to create some newer and more challenging projects and art works. The largest impact these magazines will have on my students is making them feel like someone cares enough about them to donate something 'NEW' to them. I think it will make them feel special and encourage them to be more creative and do their very best work.
needStatement: My students need 20 subscriptions to Scholastic Art Magazines for the 2014-2015 school year.

name: Little Bit of This and That
description: How cool is when you experience learning hands-on rather than looking at pictures in a book? My students are very bright five and six year olds that are very eager learners. Our school is located in a very rural portion of our school district. Many of our families live in very high poverty and often times our students come to school without the necessities.
