It doesn't matter the race or age of these students. I have one goal in mind-to build a lifelong love of reading. If my students had chromebooks, they could access digital content. My students could access their literature series and take advantage of all of the digital components: note taking, access lessons, take tests/quizzes and receive immediate feedback, and annotate their thinking as they read. Your donation will help prepare my students for the real world where digital media and content is the norm. I want my students to still be lifelong readers, but also be able to access this reading material digitally so that they are ready for high school, college, and beyond.
needStatement: My students need chromebooks to access common core curriculum using our new literature series.

name: Brand New Year, Brand New Student
description: My teaching philosophy? Well, an organized student makes for an organized mind, ready to learn and create! I teach special needs students who have difficulty with creating structure and order for themselves. By creating a classroom environment that invites them in, they are set up for a great year! My students are awesome and challenging at the same time! Living in a low income neighborhood, my students do not have sufficient funds to buy the supplies needed for school. This is not only their challenge, but mine as well. I do what I can for them; however due to budget constraints, it has been difficult to make sure they have what they need to stay organized and be creative. My students deserve the best education possible without worrying about how they will be able to afford their school supplies. By obtaining new school supplies such as binders, dividers, markers glue, pencils, page protectors, and scissors, my students can learn to be organized. This will benefit them not only in their educational career, but in their lives as well! These materials will help them concentrate on what is being taught in ELA, rather than worrying about if they have what they need because YOU will have their proverbial 'backs!' By having these basic--yet necessary--supplies, my special needs students will be able to use the pencils, binders, and page protectors to take class notes, write essays, plan projects, and preserve and share ideas with their classmates. With the markers, 'crazy' cutting scissors, and glue, they will be able to transform their ideas to actual projects and display them for the school to see and admire! Please help my students! Please make a difference in a child's life! Teaching content is important, but life skills such as organization and creativity are just as important. Help me to create brand new students with brand new supplies for a brand new year!
needStatement: My students need basic school supplies such as pencils, binders, glue, markers, page protectors, and dividers to be new, organized students!

name: Tablets for Tiny Techies
description: Our classroom is usually busy, sometimes messy, and always fun. After 12 years of working full time, being a Mommy of three, and putting myself through college, I finally achieved my lifelong dream of being a teacher. I have a passion for teaching and it shows in my first grade classroom. Growing up, I was always told to shoot for the moon. Even if I missed, I would land among the stars. These stars that I landed among are the 20 smiling first grade faces that I am blessed to work with in my classroom each day. Not only are they learning the things embedded in our math, science, literacy, and social studies curriculum, they are learning about character. They are connecting to our community and helping in any way that they can. I use their ideas to inspire our projects. This year, after learning about needs and wants, we donated food to a local shelter. After reading a story about how animals help people, we donated pet food to the animal shelter. These were all ideas that my students came up with. My students are fantastic role models for their peers, our school, and adults alike. They are my inspiration and hope for our future. It is my dream to have a set of tablets in my classroom. With tablets, my students can connect to our community even more. Not only can they connect to our community, they can also connect to the world. I would love to set up regular communication and video chats with students from across the globe. This way, my students will get a global sense of unity and learn firsthand about students who may look different, sound different, and live in a different country, but are likely very similar to them. Students would use tablets to review math facts, practice reading skills, research relevant topics, and practice their technology skills. Tablets are a wonderful, up-to-date tool that will allow my students to have relevant information at their fingertips. Not only will they be able to connect and communicate with students around the world, but they can also use them to enhance their reading, express themselves through art and music, create stories and pod-casts, explore science, and learn in a way that is enticing and relevant for this generation.
needStatement: My students need a Google Chromebook tablet to enhance their learning across the curriculum with the use of up-to-date technology.

name: Saving Ivan The Gorilla
description: 'It takes hundreds of people to turn their back on an endangered species and just two to make a difference'said Jes Fuhrmann. Many students do not understand what an endangered species is or what it means. This project will teach them about that and encourage them to stand up and protect our wildlife. I teach a 4th/5th grade combination class. My students come from a high poverty neighborhood where more than 75% of them receive free or reduced-price lunch. There are a very diverse range of home structures: nuclear, single parent, multiple-family, foster, migrant, and military, to name a few. Our students also come from a variety of ethnic backgrounds, with a large portion being Hispanic, Punjabi and African American. Additionally, we have a large population of English Language Learners. With such diversity, it is to be expected that each student is going to have a very divergent range of personal, social, emotional, and educational needs when compared to schools that serve a more homogeneous population. As a class we will be reading 'The One and Only Ivan', a story about a captured gorilla who befriends a captured baby elephant. My students will then be researching and learning more about endangered animals using the books requested. The students will be split up into groups and focus their research on one habitat and the endangered animals that live in it. During their research, the students will be using the scissors, glue sticks, and colored pens to record their information into their interactive journals. At the end of the research, each group will create presentations about the endangered species in their habitat and what we can do to help save the animals. The goal of this project is for students to share this information throughout the school and raise awareness of the animals on the endangered species list and share ways in which we can help. This project will engage and teach students through the high-interest class read, along with the other high-interest non-fiction books. Students will not only be learning about regular school topics, but they will learn how to make a difference in the world by learning about how to help and save endangered species. Life skills are embedded throughout this project as students use their research skills to figure out a way to solve a problem and take a stand for something they believe in.
needStatement: My students need a class set of 'The One and Only Ivan', non-fiction endangered animal books, as well as glue, scissors, and pens for their interactive journals.

name: Putting Guided Reading Back On The Table!
description: Part of my role of a teacher is to facilitate learning. A facilitator guides learning rather than dictates it. As a primary teacher most of my day is spent guided their learning in the area of English language arts. Guided reading is the best way to facilitate literacy skills. My students live in area of high poverty in northern New Jersey. More than half of my students qualify for free or reduced lunch. They all receive free breakfast. They are very hard working and their families are extremely supportive despite their economic shortcomings. My students all have an overwhelming desire to learn and want to make the most of their time in my class. Guided reading is small group instruction in which the teacher 'guides' students through a text that is at the children's instructional reading level. The role of the teacher is crucial in guided reading. Guided reading is planned, focused instruction. The ultimate goal is to foster independent readers. Because of the overcrowding in some classrooms, I will be transforming my current reading table to accommodate more students as desks. I need a horseshoe table that sole purpose is for guided reading. Without this guided reading table, I will be unable to meet and facilitate with each student. This table will be used to run strategy groups with 6 students at a time in order to advance their literacy skills throughout the school year.
needStatement: My students need a horseshoe table where I can meet with several students at a time to conduct guided reading.

name: Wiggle While We Work 2
description: 'Sit still and listen!' Have you ever heard that said in a classroom? Sometimes students just need to move in order to learn. As a dedicated teacher, I want to provide my students with a way to keep their bodies and minds active without disrupting the learning of others. This year I am teaching in a single-gender classroom consisting of twenty boys of varying ability levels. Our elementary school is located in a small town in South Carolina. Although the students come from a variety of backgrounds, there is one common problem that many of my students face- the need for movement. Many of my students are very active and full of energy. They often find it hard to sit still and focus on their work. Because of this, they often disrupt the learning of other students around them. My students are very smart and capable of anything; many of them just need help focusing. Standing desks and stability balls just may be the solution to our problem! The stability balls will enable students to wiggle while they work! The students will be able to move around, yet it won't distract others who are working around them. Instead of focusing on sitting still, students can focus on their learning while improving their balance, posture, and strength. The stability balls will be used for small group instruction, group work, and just anytime a child feels like they need to use one in order to focus! Students will also have access to the standing desks anytime they feel like they'd rather stand up to work/listen rather than sit still in their desks. I want to encourage my students to move and stay active, not sit still, and these alternatives will help to achieve this goal. While my active students will reap many learning and health benefits from these stools, this product will also be beneficial to the students around them because the movement is not large enough to distract my teaching or the learning of the other students. This new furniture will help all students become better focused and my teaching become uninterrupted. In terms of health and academics, everyone will benefit from the addition of standing desks and stability balls into our classroom!
needStatement: My students need two standing desks and two stability balls to help them focus while learning.

name: Please Help Us Prepare For The Upcoming School Year
description: Help us start the school year off with essential supplies! I am a third grade teacher at a prekindergarten-fifth grade, Title One elementary school in Mississippi. Due to the financial crisis that our state is facing, we have received several budget cuts. My students are excited about learning. I feel that it is my job as their teacher to make sure that they stay excited about learning, regardless of our setbacks. As a teacher, I realize the importance of starting the new school year off on the right track. I also realize that some of my new students may not have basic supplies when they enter my classroom. I believe that if I am able to provide them with basic supplies, they will start the year off motivated and excited about learning. I believe that I must start the year off by making learning visual and hands-on. This is important to me because I realize that children learn best when they are active rather than passive learners. Basic supplies that we need include dry erase markers, tape, paper, erasers, and pencils. By funding our project, you will make it possible for my students to have a successful start to the new school year! You will help me ensure that all students will be ready to learn.
needStatement: My students need basic supplies including tape, glue, paper, erasers and pencils.

name: Students Yearn To Learn
description: Some of my students have not yet discovered the possibilities of using technology. This year could be the change that makes a difference in their learning.'Technology is the pen and paper of our time, and it is the lens through which we experience much of our world. ' -David Warlick My 2nd grade students attend an inner city public school that consists of low income families. Sadly, many of the students lack the resources and support to have technology experience at home. Despite their home environment they are very inquisitive and have a strong desire to learn. School is the only place that offers opportunities for students to explore, interact, experience and learn what their financially well off peers learn at such an earlier age. Unfortunately, with the lack of cuts and funding our schools are having difficulty providing the necessary provisions to help our students prepare and compete in the 21st century. My main goal is to increase students reading abilities, promote the love of books and provide a range of learning opportunities for students to understand and grasp concepts through the use of Kindle Fires. The use of Kindle Fires will offer my students opportunities for development and participation in fun and educational learning. This engagement will equip students to better understand concepts and help them independently organize their learning experiences according to their interests and the abilities. The Kindle offers access to reading, science, social studies and math applications for various learning levels. Our internet access will allow the students to research topics and participate in district lined assessments more efficiently. Students will work independently and in small groups to complete tasks and assessments. Your support for this project will help prepare students for a changing world. Students today learn better through direct learning experiences. I believe fun and engaging learning opportunities is the formula for creating life learners. Please help me to prepare today's learners to become our future leaders.
needStatement: My students need five Kindle Fires.

name: Every Classroom Needs Supplies!
description: Everyone knows how much money educators spend to make sure their students have the necessary supplies and materials for school. This upcoming school year, I want to make sure I have the supplies in order for me to be an effective teacher and for my students to be successful. I teach third grade in a Title-One school that is predominately Hispanic. The majority of my students are English Language Learners. I spend a lot of my own money making sure my students have the basic supplies that they need for the classroom. This upcoming school year, I want to have additional supplies ready to go including chart paper, graphing paper, fluency phones, and wikki stix. The materials that I am trying to receive for my classroom will enhance my teaching as well as my students ability to be successful in the classroom. I am requesting chart paper so I can create anchor charts that my students can always refer to. The graphing paper will be used for the several math games that we play for our area and perimeter unit. I am also requesting a class set of wikki stix to engage my students in guided reading. In addition, the fluency phones will allow my students hear themselves while they practice reading. The mini-white board will allow two students to work on an activity at once. By getting this project funded, I am able to bring basic classroom supplies into my students hands. These resources will also help my students become successful in the classroom. Please consider helping my students and classroom out.
needStatement: My students need 6 fluency phones, Wikki Stixs, a classroom timer, magnetic display shelves, an easel, chart paper, and graphing paper!

name: Read Around the World: A Social Studies Connection
description: 'Where do you live?' This seems like a simple question, but our place in our city, state, country, and the world is actually a difficult concept for my students--geographically, as well as in historical, social, and political contexts. My school is located in the urban South. Nearly all of the students come from low-income families, which makes us a Title I school, and nearly all are students of color. They are eager, curious children on the brink of adolescence, and they are passionate about issues of social justice, history, and multiculturalism. With these social-studies themed books, I will be able to help open up students to the world around them. Specifically, in fifth grade we study topics throughout US History, such as the Civil War, Civil Rights, immigration, and civics. We don't have a specific block of time in our schedule for social studies, so we will use these picture books not only to become better readers and writers, but to integrate many important social studies concepts into the curriculum. I believe that representing my diverse students' backgrounds in the curriculum is incredibly important. I want to read them books with characters who look like them and come from different countries like them, so that they can learn about the complex roots of American culture. Teaching tolerance towards and acceptance of diversity is implicit in my goals of helping students grow up to be good citizens, and to be able to answer that question, 'Where do you live?'
needStatement: My students need multicultural picture books that help them learn about the world around them and subscriptions to Scholastic News.

name: Markers Please
description: I teach sixth grade math and science at a high-need, at-risk, predominately Spanish speaking middle school. I have two math intervention classes where I teach third and fourth grade math to sixth grade students. They need all of the extra help and support possible to bridge the gap as quickly as possible. Due to the budget crunch, each teacher at my school has been allotted one hundred dollars for supplies. After ordering copy paper, binder paper and pencils, there's not a lot of money left for other items such as dry erase markers. With all of the work my students do on the white boards, we run out of dry erase marker within the first month of school. I call it 'The Competition.' Each pair of students gets a white board and a dry erase marker. I put problems on the overhead, they each work it out, write the answer on the white board, and then hold it up for me to quickly say, 'Correct or try again.' They then go on to the next problem as soon as they are finished. They are very competitive and work hard at doing as many problems as possible. It is amazing to see all of my students working and working fast. I know it's because they get to write it down on a white board, and they quickly find out if they are right. I am also able to easily see who is not getting it and help them right away instead of waiting to see what they don't get on the test. The more work they do, the more they will learn. It's a shame that I have to even ask for such basic supplies, but we really need it. Your help will ensure that all of my students get a lot of practice and in turn will help bridge the gap between where my students are and where they are supposed to be by the end of sixth grade. By having plenty of dry erase markers, we are able to do a huge amount of math problems quickly.
needStatement: My students need eight dozen dry erase markers in order to do a lot of math problems quickly and in a fun way.

name: The Gift that Keeps on Giving...
description: 'Books were my pass to personal freedom. I learned to read at age three, and soon discovered there was a whole world to conquer that went beyond our farm in Mississippi.' My students come from impoverished homes where survival is priority. When my 5 and 6 years old walk into school most of them have never listened to a story or even seen a book. What parents do, or do not do, has a lasting impact on their child's reading skill and literacy. As a kindergarten teacher in an urban district, I have several challenges I must overcome in order for my students to not only learn how to read, but love to read. Books can be my student's pass to personal freedom and inspiration to change their life. My students deserve the very best. Unfortunately, our school's budget is unable to afford the resources our students need and deserve. Help my eager and loving learners reach their greatest potential! Hearing a book read on tape helps children see how the words on the page can come alive in a fluid, expressive way. It helps them focus on the sounds of words read without interruption and provides a model of fluent reading. Audio books also give children an important introduction to listening--a skill that he/she must master in order to learn to read. I plan to set up a listening center so that four children can listen to the same book at the same time. This can provide a wonderful opportunity for children to hear their favorite books read aloud again and again. The more they listen, the greater the likelihood that they will learn new vocabulary words. And, when listening with a special friend, the opportunities for playing creatively and acting out parts of the story are endless. This will be an invaluable addition to our learning centers! Many books on tape have interesting sound effects, music, and multiple narrators that are especially motivating and fun for young children. Narrators on tape tend to embellish their storytelling with silly voices and dramatic enhancements. They emphasize reading as a source of pleasure rather than a skill, and make children eager to learn how to read. Your generous donation will be a gift that will keep on giving!
needStatement: My students need a listening center to improve literacy skills as well as, read-alongs. Students enjoy using highlighter tape when playing word detectives!

name: Kindergarten Learning Rug!
description: Welcome to Maestra Claire's Kindergarten classroom! We love school! We sing, dance and learn how to be a nice friend! We learn how to read, write, and do science and math! We learn about different places in the world and celebrate each other's languages and cultures. We are the best we can My five and six-year olds come from a variety of backgrounds. They speak Spanish, English, or both! Sometimes my students speak other languages as well. 80% of my students receive free or reduced-price lunches. My school is a Spanish Immersion school in Minneapolis , so we really celebrate both language and ethnic diversity! As you can see in my photo, my carpet is faded. I currently use one-sided velcro to assign seating. This summer, though, I'm teaching in a classroom that has the rug I'm asking for! The kids LOVE taking turns walking on the numbers while the rest of the class counts out loud. I envision assigning seating by letter, color, etc. to get kids sitting with different peers each day! We could also each sit on a letter and then play ABC games. Students love MOVING to learn, and this rug makes that possible. The learning opportunities are endless! Kids would also take more pride in a more beautiful classroom with this colorful rug. They deserve it! Please give my one-of-a-kind students a beautiful rug because they deserve beautiful things- they are our future! They learn the most when they get to MOVE, and this rug makes that possible!
needStatement: My students need this rug for our meeting area.

name: Creative Classrooms!
description: By the end of the year, I want my students to show substantial growth and movement toward grade-level reading fluency and comprehension. I teach seventh grade English. My students are hard-working, funny, thoughtful, and resilient. Although they are growing up in an area facing high levels of poverty, our school is always looking for new ways to engage and encourage students to rise to the top! You can help us create creative, eye-appealing posters for projects and to anchor student knowledge. We do lots of projects in class that require posters and visual aids. This electronic cutting machine will allow students to bring their own creative and artwork to the classroom. This project allows students to recycle materials and use dies and downloaded material again and again. It is also cost effective, as students can use raw materials to create their projects, rather than precut materials. This project allows students to recycle materials and use dies and downloaded material again and again. It is also cost effective, as students can use raw materials to create their projects, rather than pre-cut materials.
needStatement: My students need a cricut cutting machine to make creative posters and projects.

name: Help Us Start the Year off 'Write' Part 2
description: A typical day in my classroom is spent exploring, learning, growing and having fun all at the same time. Not one day looks like the next and that is what makes my job the best adventure there is. However without having the right tools like a writing center my job becomes more challenging! I work at a Title I public school in New York that inspires children from kindergarten through 5th grade. We are a very diverse school with many different backgrounds in one. Many students come in not speaking any English at all and some parents require translators to communicate. My school population is extremely diverse. My class for the 2014-2015 school year will consist of 25 five year old students. They enter eager yet unsure of what to expect. I assure them that the year will be fun and engaging with many hands-on activities. I look forward to meeting them in September and to challenge them as we learn and grow together. I assure my students that they will have fun everyday with a smile and fun learning opportunities. They are MY students, but OUR future! Picture this- 25 kindergarteners moving about the room during center time, not knowing what to do. Now picture the same students working independently, with a purpose. The room is organized with the teacher is working with a small group - everyone is learning. The children are all learning and having fun doing so. However the problem I have is that the children do not have a writing center to call their own. The unit I am requesting will enable the children to have supplies at their fingertips and would encourage peer writing - it would be the perfect tool. We will be able to store group materials in the colored letter trays and each group will know exactly where to get their group activities. Sure it will take some time to create this level of independence, but it will happen especially with the help of this new addition. This center will enable me to provide peer support every child could use, organized materials and a friendly writing environment! Learning how to write can be extremely difficult and frustrating for a 5 year old, yet it is something they must do. First, they have to learn to form letters, then learn to use those letters to write words and finally learn to put these words into sentences. It can be hard work. Creating a friendly environment can help ease these worries and frustration. This writing center will be the perfect tool to creating a friendly and fun environment. Please help me teach the children of OUR future!
needStatement: My students need a writing center where they can sit with a partner and inspire one another. We also need letter trays to help keep our group work organized.

name: Ring Around The Carpet
description: Who doesn't want a comfortable place to curl up with a great book? My students are great kids. They love to read, but don't really have a comfortable place to sit and read. Our classrooms are not equipped with a carpet so we have to purchase them ourselves. My school is considered a Title 1 school where 70-80% are considered free or reduced lunch students. My students need a Maps That Teach Kids Rug to convene on during independent or group readings. With a new classroom rug, my students will be able to find a comfortable place on the floor to read either independently or as a group. This classroom rug will also serve the function of identifying all the continents and oceans that are a requirement for third grade. This rug will create a better learning environment during reading time. Your donations will give my students a comfortable place to sit during reading time. This will hopefully create an environment that will encourage reading. The students will be eager to read because of the possibility of sitting on the classroom rug.
needStatement: My students need a Maps That Teach Kids Rug to convene on during independent or group readings.

name: Bringing Yoga to the Classroom
description: A large amount of our students are low poverty and have never been exposed to yoga. I personally work with the students as a counselor to help them achieve in school and to go on to attend a post-secondary school. I believe that teaching the students yoga will help them achieve in school and in life. The students at our school are teenagers ranging from 14 years old to 18 years old. Typically our students are at-risk students who have not been exposed to yoga and all that the practice has to offer. I believe yoga will help our students build self confidence, strength, relaxation techniques, balance, patience and many more positive attributes. We will be practicing yoga in the classroom after school hours. I am simply asking for help with providing yoga mats to ensure that the students are in a safe environment while practicing yoga. The mats will stay at the school and will be given to the students to borrow when they stay after school to practice yoga. Donations to the project will improve the school because our students will learn skills that will better their every day lives. By practicing yoga, the students will learn relaxation techniques, stress relieving techniques, improve their self confidence, build on their strengths, and bring peace and balance to their lives. The students that participate in our yoga club will hopefully share their experiences with others to expand the impact of the donations provided.
needStatement: My students need yoga mats to get started on their yoga journey. These mats will provide the students with a safe surface to practice yoga.

name: Money, Money, Money... Money!
description: Our classroom is full of energy and love for life! We like to move, work in small groups, and have great conversations. My students love fun, but they also know how to work hard. They are challenged all the time because challenge fosters growth! A quote on our wall reminds us: 'We can do hard things!' My students are very enthusiastic about learning! We love our charter school in rural Idaho. The atmosphere is very warm and friendly. We are able to work in small groups, right at each student's level. Our school is known as a 'safe place' for each and every student. We love the diversity and unique perspective of each student. Our discussions are engaging and enriching because we learn from each other. My students have struggles, but they don't let that stop them! Often we make our own supplies or make do with what we can find, but some things are impossible or too time consuming to make. We could really use some help! We are super excited to learn about money and the important role it has in our lives! As part of our 'Daily Math Skills' board, we count money everyday, but it is difficult to move the coins and bills up and down. With magnetic money we will not only be able to get them on and off the board quickly, but students will be able to manipulate the coins and bills for a more interactive and hands-on experience. They can move them as they count, rearrange, and make trades. With the iPad Mini, students will be able to practice skills on their own. They will make use of the many apps available. As much as counting money together is needed and a great learning experience, students need to be able to count money on their own. This is best achieved through repetition. Repetition is most effective when it is fun and engaging! Not many people like to sit and be drilled, but everyone loves a good game! The iPad Mini will help my students gain confidence and independence in financial literacy. It is so important to become financially literate. This is a life skill that students will use daily all their lives. Their educational experience with money and finances will be enriched and strengthened with these amazing resources. It will help daily instruction become more engaging and playtime become more educational! Donating to this project will not only affect my classroom and students, but it will help build a financially literate world for future generations!
needStatement: My students need magnetic coins and bills so we can practice counting money everyday as a class and an iPad Mini with free money apps for independent practice.

name: Welcome To Kindergarten
description: The new school year will soon start and my young learners will need to have basic supplies to develop small motor skills. The first days of school can make a huge impact on my little ones and having the right tools can make the difference. Writing their names, alphabet and coloring will excite my kids. My students are active and eager new learners who look forward to many challenging activities. Our school is a Primary Center that provides many educational opportunities to all our students and their families. The students will enjoy using many different mediums as they begin to practice letters and numbers. The students will love coming to school and be excited to create in a learning environment. These supplies will give my students a much greater variety of color and line to create and explore. My students need crayons, chalk, markers, and glue sticks to complete their work as they learn about literacy and math. We will use the crayons and markers to bring lots of color to their work. These supplies will help build their small motor skill as they practice cutting, gluing and coloring through out the day. The chalk can be used outside to illustrate on the school yard. Let the learning begin! Please consider helping us start the new school year with these much needed learning tools. This project will help these tiniest of scholars have an even more fulfilling first experience. They will love coming to school and using markers, crayons and chalk to develop strong small motor skills as they learn to write their name.
needStatement: My students need the basics like crayons, markers, glue and chalk to start the school year with supplies that help promote learning.

name: The Magic of Musical Maintenance!
description: My Students: Do you love watching the Marching Band during halftime? Playing those instruments starts in 4th grade. The children LOVE to play their instruments, but they also need to learn how to maintain them and keep them in working condition! My students are energetic 4th graders who LOVE music. They want to sing, dance and play instruments. If they could do all three at the same time, they would still look for more ways to create music. The school population is entirely 3rd and 4th grade. The ensembles offered are Band, Chorus and Strings, but only 4th graders are allowed in Band and Strings. Since Kindergarten, they have learned how to listen to music, and now they want to make their own. The financial struggles in some of their households make it difficult get their own instruments, so they borrow them from the school. Unfortunately, these instruments have been around for a while, and the care, cleaning and maintenance supplies are long gone. Almost everything we have in life requires some type of care and maintenance. When you take the bicycles out of the garage after a long winter, you usually have to put air in the tires and grease up the gears. Throughout the summer, you still keep an eye on it, and make sure that everything is set for a smooth ride. The same is true for instruments. They must be cleaned and oiled/greased in order to be in good playing condition. When corks dry and crack, you cannot put or keep a clarinet together. When valves and slides are dry, it creates friction and resistance, which results in no music. The donations to this project will increase the quality of performance and practice because it will allow the students to properly care for and maintain their instruments. If the instruments are working properly, the students can practice without being distracted by instrument problems. Their lives will be changed for the better because they will know that people care about their music. It will also make them better, well-rounded musicians.
needStatement: My students need care and maintenance supplies, such as oil, grease and cleaners, for their instruments.

name: Cutting to the Core of Financial Literacy
description: Perception is everything! I want to teach my students the value of optics as it relates to economics. I teach 21 amazing second graders. We are in a high poverty, Title I school where over 75% of students receive free or reduced lunches. Many students live below the poverty line with parents working multiple jobs to provide for their needs. My students' struggles do not diminish their eagerness for learning. I set the expectations high and my students stretch to reach them. The poverty cycle affects my students in many ways. Poverty can be passed from generation to generation because of many factors, but one major factor is lack of financial literacy and understanding. Each year my students complete an economics unit. This unit is essential for developing financial skills that my students will use all their lives. I plan to use this Silhouette Cameo for an economics and math project in which students will create a restaurant menu and sales tickets. The machine will be used to cut out letters and pictures to create colorful advertising signs, sure to catch they eye of any customer. My students are motivated when they know a 'real person' has invested in their educations! Your contribution to this project will help my students develop life skills that will make them better parents, homeowners, tenants, employees, and citizens.
needStatement: My students need a Silhouette Cameo cutting machine.

name: Reading Exploration - StoryWorks Take Me Away!!
description: Reading Exploration - StoryWorks Take Me Away!! This what my students will be saying once they get the opportunity to explore the pages of this wonderful literary resource. This periodical will expose my students to a variety of genres and get them excited to read. My Title 1 school is filled with children who are waiting to be introduced to learning. Though a majority of my students are from a low socio-economic background, they are charged with enthusiasm for learning and interacting with new materials. Unfortunately, for most of them the only opportunity for this exposure is during the time they spend in school. These children depend on us to provide them with all they need to be well equipped for the world. Many of my students come from homes where either the parents do not speak English, work multiple jobs to make ends meet, or are just not involved in their children's lives. They have the hunger to learn and for these precious children an good education is their ticket out of their low economic barrier. They deserve to have the chance to turn their lives around. So when they come to school, I want to do my best to make sure they are well taken care of and that I have done everything in my power to ensure a love for learning. My students need 25 subscriptions to Scholastic StoryWorks Magazine to enhance their literary experience. These magazines have been highly recommended. I have used Scholastic Magazines in my classroom for years. Last year a colleague introduced me to StoryWorks. I was able to visit her classroom and see how she uses it with her students. I was impressed with how the students were engaged, interacted with the magazine and how they used it to collaborate in group discussions. The teacher used the issue as a starting point for individualized units of study. Watching her and her students interact and feeling the energy in the room that this magazine created gave me the motivation I needed to introduce it in my own classroom. Each subscription is centered around one essential question for students to explore. It includes 10 different genres, including poetry, interviews, and debates, just to name a few. The subscriptions also comes a digital component, allowing me to incorporate technology into the exploration of topics. Students will also be able to take these magazines home use them for homework assignments and share the information. As a teacher I know that StoryWorks will allow me to provide students with texts that are exciting to read in whole group, by themselves, or with a buddy. The variety of literature that StoryWorks provides allows students to explore beyond their borders. Unfortunately, I was not able to get this ordered through my school, but with your help my students will have a great addition to their reading selection. They will be able to have literature that can learn from and be enjoyable.
needStatement: My students need 25 subscriptions to Scholastic StoryWorks Magazine to enhance their literary experience. These magazines have been highly recommended.

name: Back to School (Yipeee!): Supply Wish List from Quill.com!
description: The tools we use to teach students are constantly changing, but the essential supplies remain the same. On a daily basis, my students use basic supplies such as colored pencils, scissors, Post-it notes, and Elmer's glue.... and these supplies are in constant need of replenishing! Like many children across the country, my students come from a community that has been hit hard by many economic and environmental issues. The majority of our students live well below the national poverty level. Many of our families earn their living from the Gulf of Mexico, which has been slowly bouncing back from numerous unfortunate circumstances....and while we do see the recovery, many of our families and students still have a difficult time buying the basic essentials needed to make the most of their elementary school years! I am requesting several different items that we use on a daily basis: Elmer's Liquid Glue, Glue Sticks, Fiskars Scissors, Crayola Colored Pencils, Pens, Cap Erasers, and Post-it-Notes. These are our most basic supplies, and while they are not very expensive items by themselves, keeping all of them adequately replenished for an entire classroom of children is! I am also requesting basic good hygiene supplies: Liquid Hand Soap, Kleenex, and Clorox Wipes..... We need these because cold and flu season is just around the corner and we have to keep our students healthy and in school in order for them to be successful.... Having adequate and appropriate supplies for my students is part of the teaching/learning process. My students need the right academic tools and adequate hygiene supplies. I need to have those supplies readily available for my students when their families can't provide them. It can be an expensive task and it takes all of us working together to make it happen! Your help is so greatly appreciated!
needStatement: My students need basic everyday school supplies that enhance the learning environment and keep us both on task and healthy!

name: Super Supplies For Our School Year
description: A welcoming friendly classroom stocked with supplies needed to welcome new students for the school year! This upcoming school year will begin my fifth year as a special education teacher at the early childhood level. I will be teaching 25 students in an integrated kindergarten classroom. This means I will be working alongside with a general education teacher to teach students with varying abilities and academic goals. Our school is Title I funded and we have a large population of students who come from homes that speak a language other then English. My students love listening to stories at the meeting area and writing stories about animals and insects. The disabilities affecting my students include speech impairment, learning disabled, emotionally disturbed and autism. I am requesting an assortment of basic classroom supplies to help get our classroom running for the upcoming school year. I am requesting assorted tags to create bus tags for students' backpacks, staples, stapler remover, different tape for student work, pens, special markers for flip charts, book rings for students' work and basic classroom office supplies. In kindergarten, we create a lot of our very own books to publish. We use a lot of tape to piece some of our pictures together and display them throughout the classroom. We love to display our student work for visitors to see! This project will make sure we have enough book rings to piece together our writing projects and enough staples in our writing center so that young writers can make as many writing booklets as they want! We are not provided with the funds to purchase the everyday basic school supplies we need to begin the school year. I want my students to enter school and walk into a classroom that is setup and ready for them to learn.
needStatement: My students need basic classroom supplies such as tags, staples, tape, a staple remover, pens, markers and book rings, for an awesome start to the school year.

name: Back To School Supplies
description: We have a variety of students that come from different economic backgrounds. Some students come with supplies, but many can't afford school supplies. Imagine being one of the many student who cannot afford the school supplies. My students are very excited and motivated to learn. The supplies that they do come with seem to break easily or do not last a school year. However, many of the students cannot afford the school supplies that they need, and they have to borrow or watch the others who do have supplies. Our school has about a 75% poverty level. The supplies we are asking for are very important to my students' learning. The post-it notes are wonderful for my students to take notes on while they are reading. The colored pens are perfect for my students to have at their fingertips while completing their thinking maps. The take-home folders are a nice addition for taking home their papers and notes so they don't lose their papers. The lined paper is greatly need for my students to complete much of their work. With all the state cutbacks in education, receiving grants from generous organizations is in great need for our classroom to continue to teach our students. This project is important so that the students have the supplies needed for day-to-day activities. All students will have the same supplies and no one will feel left out. We are asking for lined paper, colored copy paper, sticky notes, take-home folders and pens. Please consider donating to my classroom's project as it will really help the students that will be in my class next year. This will allow all of the students to start off on equal ground for their education. This will also allow me, as a teacher, to supply my class with the classroom work that they need to further their education. My students need many supplies to get us through the year, including pens for thinking maps, sticky notes for note taking, take home folders to carry paper, dry erase markers for using white boards, pencil sharpeners to keep their pencils going, tape dispensers and staplers for completing projects.
needStatement: My students need post-it notes to take notes, four color pens for Thinking Maps, and work folders to organize their work.

name: Power of the Student Only Printer
description: Remember when you printed your paper out for your teacher to edit? Or you needed to print an article instead of reading it online? What if you did not have access to your own printer? First, my students are amazing. They are resilient, hard working, enthusiastic, and they love to learn. Most of them come from an undeserved community-- high poverty, violent neighborhoods, and a lack of access to technology and computers. Our school is a Title 1 school in North Charleston, SC, and it is truly a wonderful place to learn and teach. In our Personal Mastery classroom, we set high expectations of independent learning, and students practice solving problems themselves. This process is slowed when, I, the teacher, have to be in control of what is printed (papers, projects, research articles, etc). Our goal is be as paperless as possible without putting kinks in a student's personal learning experience. So- students will use this paper and ink in the STUDENT ONLY printer station. If they need to print an article and annotate, this is where they can do that. If they need to print a paper or creative piece of writing for editing, they have a space to do so (without having to ask me for help). I have a printer. My students need paper and ink to go with it. This STUDENT ONLY printer station will allow students to practice and strengthen independent problem solving skills. It will give them more control over their learning, reading, and writing.
needStatement: My students need paper and ink for their student ONLY printer station.

name: With Clay And Glaze, Our Students Will Amaze!
description: 'Every child is an artist.' - Pablo Picasso --I believe that everyone is an artist. We just need to find our medium and style. The majority of my students have never even touched clay before. My aim is to widen their horizon with another medium to work with and help them find their artistic style I consider myself lucky because I get to teach all of the students in my school. Our students range from 4K to 5th grade, and we also have two wonderful Autism spectrum classes, which are split by grade level. Though it is a small school, we have a lot of diversity which makes for a fun, well-rounded educational setting. The students hold a wide array of interests and hobbies. Each child has a distinct personality which really shines through in each work of art they create. I love watching them work and use creative problem solving to fit their own style and ideas into the artwork they are working on. I am so inspired every day watching them work. I personally feel that my students and I are very fortunate, because though we may not have a large budget, we have a school that shares my philosophy that each child has their own unique style and should be allowed to express that. Each child is taught the same techniques and materials, but are allowed to interpret it in their own way. The exact artwork they will be creating will vary by grade level, but I want my students to build their fine motor skills and learn the three basic hand building techniques: pinching, coiling, and slabs. The upper grades will learn to score and slip as well. I will also be focusing on mosaics with 5th grade and we will be creating a collaborative mosaic on a wall in the garden outside of the Art Room. For every grade level, I will also be teaching about functionality of artwork. This is where the glaze is important. I want the students to understand that glaze isn't just for decoration, it also serves a purpose. It is the reason that they are able to eat and drink out of the clay cups and bowls they make in class. The Art Teacher before me left behind a kiln and a wonderful set of clay tools, but we have no clay or glaze to work with. The little budget I have is not enough to cover the cost of theses materials. The materials would mean the world to my students and me! Building with your hands is a very empowering experience. I want for my students to have the opportunity to build their fine motor skills and express themselves in a completely new and different way than they ever have before. These donations would be so helpful as my students grow and learn to develop their artistic style. The world is calling for creative thinkers and I want my students to have every chance possible to learn new skills and techniques.
needStatement: My students need clay and low fire color and clear glaze.

name: Music Makes Little Minds Grow
description: My students come to school eager and excited. They love to move to music. This last year, our school was 78% free and reduced lunch. Research shows that integrating movement and music into the daily routine is a highly effective method of achieving learning for children from high poverty. My students are happy children who feel safe, and excited to come to school. Our school is the heart of our community. Each child is greeted in the morning by name as he or she enters the school. Our school is, for many of them, their place of peace. My students have big hopes and dreams for their futures and want to learn. Each child in my class feels valued and important. They count on me to deliver lessons that challenge them as individuals - and as a team. I work hard to ensure that all my students are working at their own ability level. If you were to visit our classroom, you would see how music and movement is used seamlessly throughout our day. My students and I use music for the purpose of unifying and building community, as well as for teaching and learning. Picture it if you will... 15 - five year old children are waiting for you to locate and deliver their favorite Dr. Jean alphabet warm up song, 'Who Let the Letters Out.' Because my current system is so cumbersome, my cheeks grow redder and redder as I realize that I'm wasting their valuable time trying to efficiently maneuver though the stacks of antiquated CDs and the CD player. With the Ipod Touch and JBL speaker system, that valuable time is spared and student time is used effectively! Kindergarteners love exploring and enjoy sharing their knowledge with others. In addition to the ability to play music, other features of the Ipod Touch will enable my students to practice and grow by: capturing pictures of their work, recording themselves practicing their reading, and researching topics via the Internet. I am excited to think they would be able to use such an empowering piece of equipment! This Ipod Touch and JBL docking station will allow me to create playlists that can be easily accessed and rapidly available to be used in teaching: math, reading, writing, letter shapes, science, social studies, OT, and for having FUN! My students will also have shared access to these tools by being able to: take pictures, record their reading, and research online. It would open so many doors of possibility for my creative kids! I can only imagine what else they may think of!
needStatement: My students need the Ipod Touch and JBL docking station because integrating music across the curriculum is a proven method of addressing all learning styles.

name: Who Says Nonfiction is Fun to Read? We Do! We Do!
description: I greet my students at the door each morning. We say hello in different languages depending on the day of the week. They love saying 'hello' from different parts of the world. One of my challenges is to teach them about the world around them. This is one of many ways I teach multiculturalism. My students are bright five-year-olds. They love school and they love to learn. Often at my school I have to gather resources on my own to make the learning fun and relevant, but it is so worth it. When I see how engaged my students are in the learning, it's priceless. My school is in a low income community. All of the students qualify for free lunch. Many of my students live in the neighborhood. They consider the school, 'their school' and they absolutely love being there. My students and their parents know how important learning and being college and career ready is. At any point, you could come in my room and ask, 'What's more important than learning?' and they will reply, 'Nothing!' Another catch-phrase I say to them is, ' We're getting the knowledge..' and they respond, 'to go to college.' Beginning in Kindergarten, I want my students to already have the mindset they are going to college. I want them to learn about not just their community, but the World Community. These magazines are for kindergarten learners. These magazines allow my students to learn about the world around them in a fun, colorful, and inquisitive way. Two of the magazines infuse the learning around social studies topics that are engaging and current events. The science magazine will pique the interest of those little scientists in my classroom and nourish those inquisitive minds. My students will be able to read most of the magazine on their own. They will participate in group talks about what they have learned and ask questions about the information they read to their peers. What amazing book talks they could have around this nonfiction reading material. These magazines also teach map skills, geography, math, phonics, and many comprehension strategies. Funding this project will allow me to teach my students about the world around them using colorful, kid-friendly, and inviting photographs. They will see students the same age as them, in different parts of the world, learning, living, and growing. If my students are allowed to get their hands on these magazines, I feel they will have an even more appreciation for nonfiction, social studies, and the sciences. They are already eager to learn. These magazines will just make it more fun!
needStatement: My students need nonfiction science and social studies reading magazines on their grade level.

name: Classroom Supplies
description: Do you remember creating science projects (critters and straw rockets) and writing laboratory reports to portray what you know? My young men do this all year round.  My young men are determined, intelligent and grateful for the opportunities that they are given. They come from some of the poorest and roughest areas of New York, but still they shine. They arrive to school every day with a thirst for knowledge and the realization that our small school is their biggest chance to succeed. Our school is a Title I public school, but our goal is specific and unique. We are preparing young men of color to be future leaders. My students are aware of the statistic that a majority students of color do not graduate high school and even less of them go on to college. At my school, my students believe they can and will succeed in life. They know their education is the key to help them flourish. The materials requested will be used in the following ways: 1. The bulletin board borders will be used to enhance the area in which the young men display their hard work. 2. The shipping tape will be used to tape up projects, posters and other classroom fixtures. 3. The white board cleaner will be used to revitalize our white boards at the end of the school day. 4. The trays will be used to collect assignments from students. 5. The post-its will be used to organize notebooks, write questions on the parking lot, etc. A classroom's environment is extremely important factor in learning. One that supports children and makes them feel welcomed may be the difference between a child coming to class or a child not coming. The supplies that are requested will be used to create a home for the children where they have access to an organized, clean and student-oriented room.
needStatement: My students need bulletin board supplies to beautify the area in which they display their hard work.

name: Ouch! Ow! We Need a Rug Now!
description: Our classroom is full of energy and love for life! We like to move, work in small groups, and have great conversations. My students love fun but also know how to work hard. They are challenged all the time because challenge fosters growth! A quote on our wall reminds us: 'We can do hard things!' My students are very enthusiastic about learning! We love our charter school in rural Idaho. The atmosphere is very warm and friendly. We are able to work in small groups, right at each student's level. Our school is known as a 'safe place' for each and every student. We love the diversity and unique perspective of each student. Our discussions are engaging and enriching because we learn from each other. My students have struggles, but they don't let that stop them! Often we make our own supplies or make do with what we can find, but some things are impossible or too time consuming to make. We could really use some help! Imagine sitting directly on a hard floor while learning. Would you be able to concentrate? I know I wouldn't. We meet on the floor for math and reading. It helps my students in many ways. It gets them up and moving. It helps them focus on what we are doing because they are facing the board without distractions in the way. Plus, I am able to keep an eye on their faces to determine their level of understanding of the concepts we are learning. We love our carpet time, but we can't have carpet time without carpet! I also let students sit on the floor if they prefer to during testing when possible. It is so much easier to perform well when you are comfortable. I remember taking so many tests on a hard chair. It is no fun! I don't think a hard floor would be any better, but a carpet would be ideal! Third grade is an important time for students. It is when many are deciding what their attitude towards education will be throughout their lives. A positive experience in third grade will affect their whole lives. A classroom meeting rug will increase their attention and focus as well as their comfort and attitude towards school. Please help improve their learning experience with a classroom rug!
needStatement: My students need a classroom rug! We are moving into a new classroom, but it doesn't have carpet.

name: Getting Creative With 1st Graders!
description: I believe that classrooms should belong to the students and not just the teacher. I try to create an environment where students take pride in their classroom and design it to their artistic and individual personalities. In our classroom, students' own beautiful works of art decorate the walls. My students are bright, active, and sweet young learners. They are eager to learn whatever it is that I am willing to share. Although academics is a large part of the curriculum, I like to incorporate art and fun crafts to each lesson in order to keep the creativity alive in my classroom. I believe that it is just as important to keep students engaged with the arts - especially since budget cuts keep cutting costs in music, art, and physical education. I am currently a 1st grade teacher working in a Title One school in Los Angeles, Ca, where many students receive free or reduced lunch. My class also serves English Language Learners and a few students who receive extra support from the Resource Specialist for various needs. With a variety of abilities and disabilities in my classroom, it is important to provide my class with additional resources in order to meet the needs of all students and to keep them engaged in the curriculum. All of these materials will be used in the classroom and will benefit all of my students. With these materials, students will explore their individuality and create masterpieces in which they will be able to take home and treasure with family and friends. I truly enjoy incorporating art with academic lessons. By doing so, I am able to keep students engaged and students are able to explore their artistic and creative capabilities. With the beads, jewels, and gems, students can create beautiful works of art. Moreover, they can also practice creating patterns with numbers, size, color, and so much more. While working with these materials, students also practice developing their fine motor skills while they cut, arrange, and manipulate various objects with their tiny, little fingers and hands. With these materials, you would provide so much more than what you would think to these students. You are giving them art, education, creativity, individuality, fine motor skills, and so much more. The donations to this project will truly help my students gain a sense of individuality in our classroom of twenty-five first grade students. With these donations, they will be able to explore their creativity, their likes and dislikes, and they will be able to take ownership of their own education by being able to create their own works of art.
needStatement: My students need art supplies, such as: beads, sequins, gems, glitter, jewels, pipe cleaner, foam shapes, craft sticks, scratch paper, and decorate your own tote bags.

name: Classroom Books
description: A typical day in my classroom is filled with lots of energy and laughter. I believe in order for my students to succeed we need to have a positive attitude and get excited about learning. I would love for all of my future students to learn how to read by the end of the year! I have not had the privilege to meet my new students yet! I can say that I am excited to meet my new little ones. My school is considered a Title 1 school, and we have many students who are economically disadvantaged. This could scare some people, but I have a heart to capture these students and love them! I want children to be confident in the books they are reading and they can't be confident if the books are too hard, and not at their level. The books I have requested are books leveled at A, B,C and D, the appropriate levels for kindergarteners. These books will be put to good use. Each and every week children will shop for books 5 books at their level. Reading is the beginning and foundation for a learner. I want my students to love reading the way I do. I also want them, as I mentioned earlier, to be confident readers. The books I would like to be donated will do just that! These 'easy readers' will be the gateway for many students' success! Not only will they learn how to read from them, but hopefully learn to love reading. These books have such an important role for my precious kiddos, and I can't wait for them to put them to good use!
needStatement: My students need books for the classroom they can read on their level including: Five Little Monsters, Zoom Zoom Zoom, and Quick As a Cricket.

name: Little Listeners Learn To Count, Read And Write!
description: 'I can't hear anything, it's not working!' 'We already heard this one.' These are the words I hear from my kindergarten students everyday. Our listening center library is getting old, the tapes are drying out and snapping. We don't have many titles left and the kids are getting bored. Many of my students have not been exposed to high quality children's literature, had opportunities to be read to or learned how to handle books appropriately. It is amazing how my active little ones calm right down and enjoy listening to a good book. My high energy students all settle down and get pulled into the story. They need access to many books so they can hear the sequence of a good story, be exposed to new vocabulary, practice handling books carefully, opening the book from the proper direction and turning pages efficiently. Our school listening center library is aging. Many books are missing pages, the tapes are breaking and we simply don't have enough titles for children to select from each day. During our Daily 5 literacy and math stations, students enjoy participating in a variety of activities. While they are engaged in their stations, I work with small groups of students on specific reading, writing and math skills. Students look forward to their time at the listening center station but are often frustrated when the tape doesn't work or pages fall out of their book. They get bored listening to the same stories over and over! This causes many disruptions and students often interrupt our small group instruction time because of problems at the listening center. Having working CD's and some new titles will be so exciting for them! Titles that include mathematical concepts have the added bonus of sparking their interest in this area and encouraging them to think mathematically. Keeping their interest at the station will allow me to work with small groups of students, uninterrupted. This instruction time is vital to their development as readers, writers and mathematicians! Kindergarten is a magical time! Fostering a love of reading and mathematics from a young age will have a lasting impact on my students' academic lives. My students deserve to be exposed to high quality children's literature. Your donation will allow them to enjoy and learn from variety of books that they would otherwise not get to experience. Thank you for your gift!
needStatement: My students need a set of math read along stories.

name: When We Grow Up, We Want to Be Like...Mo Willems!
description: Do you remember the excitement you had when your parents read a bedtime story to you? Do you remember the joy you got when you sat in a favorite spot and read a book? A lot of the children in my class have never had the opportunity to grow a love for literature and have not discovered the joy of reading. My students face many challenges in their lives. I teach kindergarten in a community where over 70% of the children are eligible for free or reduced priced lunch. They come from a variety of different backgrounds, and their experiences are oftentimes limited. They have one thing in common, they LOVE to learn! They come in every day with a smile, a positive attitude, and do everything they can to be successful in school! My class last year was particularly fond of all Mo Willem's books. I could not get ahold of enough of these books to get their reading appetites satisfied. To say they were obsessed is an understatement. There were rarely any available in our library because they always checked them out. They knew exactly where to go to find them on the shelf. Most of these kids had come in not knowing who Mo Willems was. Throughout the year they had formed an obsession and wanted to be just like him. This led to some amazing opportunities for my kids. We did author studies and studied his writing style as well as his illustrations. The children created their own books in Willems style. The books also served as great read-alouds and gave the children so many opportunities to practice emotions and voice when reading. Because of all of these wonderful things, I want to build a collection of Mo Willems books for my future classes to enjoy. Your investment in our classroom will provide high quality mentor texts for my children (which they might not have access to at home otherwise). I would love to be able to send these books home as well so that the children can grow a love of reading and become passionate readers.
needStatement: My students need access to high quality children's literature. Mo Willems books were highly sought after in my classroom last year.

name: Writing Supplies Needed for Future Authors
description: The majority of my students live in the Homeless Shelter across the street from the school. Parental involvement is minimal. Most of them come to school without even a pencil. This year, I will make writers out of them all! It will be a challenge but one that I'm up for. My students are from a low socio-economic area of Homestead, Florida. I am often called 'mommy ' by accident in the classroom. They are children that with just a little love and attention can go places. My school is only 6 years old and a Title 1 School. Our grades have been going progressively down. I feel that if we were given the tools to succeed, it would make it so much easier. All students in 4th grade had to take the Florida Writes test. That test is now obsolete and a new test is on the horizon. It is imperative that they practice writing responses to questions this year. I plan on using these composition books and highlighters for this purpose. I love to see the progress made when I ask them to write something on day one and then look at their last day of writing. Wow---what a difference and they are excited about it!Donations will improve my classroom because the children will have some of the supplies they need to excel. I cannot afford to buy these things for them, so I would be forever grateful for this and any other basic supplies. For my students, it will be like Christmas in August!
needStatement: My students need composition books to do their daily writing. Throughout my lessons, we use highlighters to mark different parts of their essays.

name: Fabulous First Graders
description: 'Tell me and I forget. Teach me and I remember. Involve me and I learn.' Benjamin Franklin In my classroom, my students are my family and I want the very best for my family. I want my students to be able to walk away from my classroom being empowered with the skills to read, write and do math! My students are spectacular human beings who have overcome insurmountable obstacles in their short lifetimes. They come from an area of extreme poverty and many do not even come to school with a school bag or school supplies. They come to school hungry to learn anything that I present them with. My school is located in a extremely poverty stricken location in the Kensington location of Philadelphia. The students are mostly Hispanic and many students in my classroom speak mainly Spanish at school and at home. Their parents are not literate in English and many families lack the resources to help their child succeed. School becomes a safe haven and miracle location for my students to have a safe and encouraging environment to expand their constantly growing minds. I do my best to provide my students with all of the resources they need but at times cannot provide as well as I wish I could. My students deserve the very best that our school can offer to make them successful learners! My students need eight sets of headphones, 40 journals and a case of paper to improve literacy and writing skills. Journals- These journals will provide my students the chance to complete a daily journal writing on a topic of the students choice. This will allow them to apply the writing skills that they learned in an authentic writing piece. The design of these journals will allow the students the opportunity to illustrate their journal entry as well as demonstrates how their skills have developed over time. Stamp- This stamp will allow me to stamp the students journals each day to record the date of their journal entries/ Headphones- With two classroom computers and a listening center, headphones will allow my students to listen to stories and to participate in educational technology resources and stay focused without interrupting the education of the other students. Paper- Paper will allow me to print enrichment and intervention materials to assist my students in learning. It will help me to provide them with worksheets and homework assignments to practice the skills that I teach them. This project will improve my classroom by giving my students the resources they need to be successful students. These materials will allow them the opportunity to grow as learners and to have all necessary resources available at their fingertips. Reading and writing is so important for students to learn and this project will help my students to become successful readers and writers.
needStatement: My students need eight sets of headphones, 40 journals and a case of paper to improve literacy and writing skills.

name: Play-Doh Helps Us Learn!!!
description: 'All hands-on deck!' Is something my students hear often. My kindergarten students attend an urban charter school where 97% of our school is in poverty. My students are hard workers and have the desire to learn. I want each of my students to have high learning gains and be able to create learning goals! I want them to love learning! The play-doh and the letters/numbers/shapes cutters will be used during reading and math time! The letter cutters will be used to teach students their alphabet and letter sounds. The number cutters will be used to help students with number recognition, adding, and subtracting. The shape cutters will be used to teach students about 2D and 3D shapes. The puppets will be used during literacy to help bring the stories and lessons to life! The laminating pouches will be used to laminate centers so that they can be reused. By donating to this project you will help get my students even more engaged in their learning! They will be able to take responsibility of their learning through hands-on experiences. You will be helping develop better readers and problem solvers. Thank you for considering this project!
needStatement: My students need play-doh, letter cutters, number cutters, shape cutters, puppets, and laminating pouches!!!

name: Create, Learn, & Grow with Play-Doh
description: Second graders spend lots of time moving, playing, and learning with hands-on activities. Learning to spell can be difficult, but building and creating words and shapes with Play Doh will help these words stick. My students are 7-8 year olds in a high poverty school. They come from a wide range of ethnic and cultural backgrounds. More than half of the students qualify for free and reduced priced lunches. Having a safe and comfortable place to come and learn is of top priority for me. With a variety of Play-Doh options and the letters, numbers, and shape cut-outs to go along with the modeling compound my students will be able to do some hands-on word work and math center activities. Imagine learning to spell by creating the words out of Play-Doh. Think about how much fun it would be to re-create a story problem using colorful Play-Doh instead of just a worksheet. It is these type of activities that help ground the investigative learning I am helping students explore each day in my classroom. All great leaders were once curious children. I want to help foster their creativity and allow my students to learn the much needed skill of Math, Reading, and Science but in an approach that is developmentally appropriate for 2nd graders. By helping us you are investing in tomorrows leaders.
needStatement: My students need Letter and Number Cut-Outs and Playdoh.

name: Write On, Noble Countrymen! Creating Writers' Notebooks
description: I push my language arts kids to read and write as much as they can. In 9th and 10th grade English, I'm pushing them to express themselves, explore their ideas, and learn more about themselves through their writing.
