needStatement: My students need crates so I can make them seats to sit on, so they can wiggle around without being a distraction to the classroom learning.

name: Flexible Seating for All Learners
description: As a teacher in a low-income/high poverty school, my students are faced with several challenges both in and out of the classroom. Many of them receive free and reduced breakfast and lunch at school. Despite these challenges that they face, my students come to school with positive attitudes, and are always excited to learn and grow. The students in my classroom are very curious, and love to read and learn new things. They are also very active, always moving around and have a hard time sitting still. From the minute they walk in the door of my classroom I focus on their potential and growth while they are with me. I may not be able to control their home lives, however, I can certainly control their experience during the school day. I hope to create a classroom that encourages creativity, and allows my students ample opportunities for exploration and meaningful learning. These flexible seating options will allow my students to work around the classroom in comfortable seating for their learning style. Each learner in my classroom has a different learning style. With the option of flexible seating options my students will be able to choose an option that works for their learning style. The students will be able to move the seats wherever they prefer in the room to get their work done. I already have clipboards for them to use while sitting in these seats, and have asked for lap trays for students who would prefer that option. These chairs and lap trays will also help fidgety students focus while getting their work done.
needStatement: My students need flexible seating to help them stay focused while working in the classroom.

name: Wiggles and Wonder
description: I haven't met my new students yet but I hear they are a great group from diverse back grounds. More than half of our students are from low‑income households and I wish to create a comfortable and home-like environment for them. I grew up in this school district and I am so excited to be back! First graders are wiggly and inquisitive! I've taught first grade for the last three years and know that every group is very different. I am so excited to meet my new group of kiddos and to set up an exciting and welcoming classroom. Flexible seating is not only a trend in education, it provides life lessons in choice and problem solving. Tolerance us the ability or willingness to tolerate something, in particular the existence of opinions or behavior that one does not necessarily agree with. Teachers and students alike practice tolerance each day when they make choices for both themselves and others. Flexible seating including bouncy bands and wiggle seats, and working with building materials are two examples of when students must tolerate each other and share. Students with choice have a sense of ownership and students who want to use the same materials must learn to problem solve and find compromise. Kayla Delzer, a pioneer in flexible seating says, 'I've found that some of the immediate benefits of flexible seating include burning more calories...increased motivation and engagement, creating a better oxygen flow to the brain, and improving core strength for over all posture.' If it's good for kids, it's good for classrooms. My project also includes some creative exploration items such as magnetic tiles and building blocks. So much of what we do in the classroom is academically focused that it is easy to forget that creativity and building challenges and exercises the brain in important ways as well. The best thing about items like these are that the kids just think they are playing but in reality they are solving problems and challenging themselves while also building crucial fine motor skills.
needStatement: My students need wiggle seats and bouncy bands for choice seating and creative building materials such as magnetic tiles and Domino blocks.

name: Pencils are Power
description: I teach sixth-grade English Language Arts in New Orleans, Louisiana. I help students discover their skills as critical readers of the world around them. I help them use their voices to change the narratives that have been written about them and inform their own identities.I teach students who come from all over the city of New Orleans based on a promise to get them to and through college. I teach predominantly students of color who receive free and reduced price lunch and travel long distances to attend our school. I believe in our national promise to educate all of America's children to the best of our abilities. Pencils are the tools my students wield to change the world. There is often a shortage of pencils at my school. Students are asked to bring their own pencils to school but don't always do so. A pencil is the most empowering tool I can give a student in my classroom besides a book. It is the weapon with which they shape and reform their own perspectives of themselves and the world around them. It gives them the ability to express themselves when so many others seek to define my students without even knowing them. It is their microphone in a sea of voices seeking to discount them.
needStatement: My students need pencils with which to express themselves in writing.

name: Let's Get Excited about the ABCs!
description: Our school is located on the Monterey Peninsula in Seaside, California. Our school services students from K-5th grade. It is a lower income school with mostly limited English proficient students. Many have not attended pre school. Students come to school excited about learning and it is so fun to watch them grow and thrive.I'm always looking for exciting new ways to engage the students and having the proper equipment and supplies allows the students to be active and to reach their full potential. Many of the students at our school are English language learners. It is so important that they gain a strong foundation of letter name and sound recognition and the activities I plan to order will help them achieve this goal. The alphabet learning locks will help students learn about upper and lowercase letters. The letter recognition instant learning center will allow students to practice and learn the ABC letter names and sounds. The write and wipe ABC practice cards will give students practice printing letters and the alphabet dough mats will give students the oppo The colorful well designed activities will stimulate the students and get them excited about learning!We will be grouping a lot in small centers and the activities will help offer a bigger variety of activities for the students to choose from. Giving a variety of choices to students is so important. It's also important for them to have fun while they are learning.
needStatement: My students need alphabet locks, instant learning center, alphabet practice cards and alphabet dough mats that help them learn letter names and sounds.

name: A Home for Our Books
description: I have a class full of scholars who are ready to take on 4th grade and make the most of it. We start every morning with a class chant and a handshake on the rug, then get right to work so we can get the most out of every minute of every day. Our school is an innovation school with a very diverse student body, and the school is expanding due to its great success meeting student and community needs. My classroom needs a set of bookshelves. We were lucky enough to receive a brand new classroom library, filled with a variety of genres to engage and excite students about reading! In fourth grade, students continue to grow as readers, reading to learn and process the world around them. I want my students to stay passionate about reading as they embrace the challenges that 4th grade learning brings! To make the library welcoming, I want to make sure books can be stored and organized in a way that feels accessible and appealing to students. The bookshelves requested will help me organize by genre, interests, levels, and most importantly inspire students to access and care for a wide variety of wonderful literature. The process of loving books, loving to read, and respecting books for the magic with which they provide them is a crucial part of being a lifelong reader!
needStatement: My students need bookshelves to store our brand new classroom library!

name: Alphabet Exploration
description: Enthusiastic, eager to learn, hard working, inquisitive, and funny are only a few words that describe my Kindergarten students! Every morning they come to school with a big smile on their little faces. Each day I look forward to their welcoming “Good Morning Mrs. Rodrick!” Our class is both ethnically and economically diverse with English Language Learners making up nearly half the class. My students range between five and six years old. Yet they instinctively treat one another with respect and courtesy. From the time they enter our classroom until the bell rings at 3:10 p.m. they are actively engaged in hands on, student centered learning activities that maintain their focus and broaden their academic horizons. Kindergarten is where the foundation of developing literacy skills takes place. My Kindergarten students need to learn the letters and sounds of the alphabet in order to begin decoding words. We work on letter recognition the first few months of school. Letter recognition is a key step in a student's ability to learn to read and write. Visuals and hands on activities help young students learn and master important skills they need to succeed in the classroom. Making sure students are engaged both during whole group and small group instruction is crucial in the learning process. I believe the supplies I am asking for will give the students a way to interact with the alphabet through hands on play. The all about letters pocket chart will be used during whole group instruction in order to reinforce the letters and sounds. The other supplies will allow my students to learn through 'play' because Kindergartners love using play dough, stickers, and snap cubes. What better way to learn then through using fun manipulatives!
needStatement: My students need letter blocks, letter pocket chart, alphabet stickers and alphabet dough mats to reinforce the letters and sounds of the alphabet.

name: Make My Learning Personal
description: I teach in a high-poverty school in the Bay Area whose student body is almost entirely comprised of immigrant families. Our families have created a close-knit community that supports each other's basic needs, and our school is developing instructional methods that support our students' acquisition and use of language and academic concepts. This coming year, I will be transitioning from a third grade classroom to a fifth grade classroom. My grade-level teammates and I are planning to implement a workshop model in reading and writing, to help our students develop positive relationships with books and the authors who create them. We are also looking for ways to develop a comprehensive math program that introduces fifth grade math concepts while continuing to develop foundational math skills. Our students are active, social, inquisitive, and eager to grow. Please join our journey through fifth grade!My students come from diverse educational and family backgrounds, and they are all working hard to learn English and live up to their families' hopes and dreams for their futures. Some of my students have been recently reclassified as fluent English speakers and are reading on grade level, while others are new to the country and have limited literacy skills, even in their first languages. I work to provide opportunities for individualized practice with language and literacy skills through adaptive websites and personalized learning goals. A strong sense of personal space within a community-based classroom is critical to student success. Fifth graders need to be able to keep their personal learning goals private. During a research project, one student may be using an early literacy site that has text-to-speech capabilities, such as PebbleGo, while his neighbor researches the same topic on the online version of Encyclopedia Britannica. Headphones allow each student to use the technological resources he or she needs without feeling limited by his or her skill level. Individual storage cases allow students to keep their headphones organized, extending the lifespan of the delicate earbuds. In addition to headphones and storage, my students each deserve a physical space to call their own. I currently have 24 student mailboxes, which students use to save important papers to take home. I need to add another column of mailboxes to that each student has a separate storage space.
needStatement: My students need headphones, storage, and mailboxes to develop and feel ownership over personal spaces within our community-based classroom.

name: Embracing Flexible Seating in Math
description: It is hard to describe a typical day in my classroom because I like to mix it up a lot! It is my goal every year to challenge and engage students in a variety of ways, especially through projects and real-world examples. My students come from all different backgrounds and it is really interesting to see them all learning Algebra together. My students are honors students, so I have to always find new ways of keeping them challenged and engaged. Last year, we started using flexible seating in our classroom, and students loved it! Flexible seating means that all students have choices about where to sit. The requested bar stools and office chair will replace some worn-out pieces. They also adjust in height - which is great for tall or short students - and they swivel, which gives students the freedom for movement without distracting others. My students love the furniture because they can be comfortable no matter what their body type or learning style is! Having quality pieces of furniture for my students is important to me because it allows them to focus more and to be able to collaborate easily in their groups.
needStatement: My students need adjustable swivel chairs for our flexible seating classroom.

name: Supplies Needed for a Community of Lifelong Learners
description: My students come from diverse backgrounds. Our school is a Title I campus, which means about 700 students live in low-income housing and receive a free or reduced lunch. Many students are responsible to care for younger siblings while their parents work multiple jobs in order to provide for their family. I provide my students with a rich, nurturing environment where they know they are safe and capable of reaching their goals and dreams. I believe in my kids and challenge them to believe in themselves. I know I have an important job to not only make a difference in their lives, but to also instill valuable life-experiences that will hopefully aid them for years to come. 'We are not magicians, we are MATHEMATICIANS'! My math lessons and reviews all work around our interactive math journal. In the journal, the students keep track of learning goals, math notes and assignments, along with writing reflections. They create foldables that we then glue into the notebook which often lead to meaningful math connections. I use colored paper to differentiate between multiple math concepts. Journals are considered our 'Mathematician Notebooks' and are used daily. Students realize the importance of using these journals to collect and analyze data. Because it is a math class and we're learning new concepts and sometimes make mistakes, pencils are a hot commodity along with extra erasers.
needStatement: My students need the necessary school supplies because unfortunately many of them cannot afford to purchase their own. With your donation, my students will have the tools they need to have a successful school year.

name: First Grade Fun!
description: I am so excited to begin teaching first grade at an elementary school in Vacaville beginning in August. I will have a classroom full of students eager to learn. This will be my first year as a teacher and I am in my dream position of first grade. Our school is a Title I school and many students come from low-income homes. There is a very large population of second language learners within the school. This creates a great need for supplies to enhance their learning environment. The students deserve all of the tools possible to be successful! I hope to be able to provide them with everything that they need. Teaching in a Title I school means that my students have very little resources. As a first year teacher, I need to provide a lot of supplies to these students in order to help them become successful. In first grade my students will have carpet time a majority of the day. This means that they will need a place to sit. The carpet that I have chosen provides a spot for each of my students. The lapboards are also a big part of carpet time. During many subjects the students will need dry erase lap boards to practice things like addition, spelling, phonics, etc. First grade is a highly rewarding year to teach as my students will be learning to read! Therefore, the word building boards will help them practice, practice, practice. I will use the cubbies as a place for each student to have their own space which will hold their homework, any paperwork that needs to go home, and any finished classwork. Finally, my students will use the paint and caddies for their table groups. Each group will have access to their own caddy full of paint, markers, crayons, etc.
needStatement: My students need a lot of carpet time in first grade! They also need lap boards for math and phonics. Finally, they need art supplies and caddies for them to have access for creative time.

name: Math Manipulatives For Sixth Grade!
description: My students come from a tight-knit community where education is strongly valued. They have a thirst for knowledge and deserve to have all the tools they need to succeed. I teach sixty vivacious eleven and twelve year olds. My sixth graders are funny, enthusiastic, and hard-working! They come to school daily with a smile on their faces and they put a smile on mine. They deserve the best tools in their education to help them get far in their lives and accomplish their dreams! This project will make a difference in my students' learning by helping to make math easier to understand and fun for them! I have many students who loathe math, and I hope to turn around their attitudes this school year through hands-on activities, interactive projects and new ways of looking at math. My students need to realize that math can be fun for anyone. These math manipulatives will help provide them with more joy and provide opportunities for differentiation in my classroom. With these tools, I can split students into small math centers or intervention groups to spend more time on their individual needs.
needStatement: My students need math manipulatives so they can experience content in a variety of ways.

name: Chromebooks for Computer Literacy
description: 'Be silly, Be honest, Be kind.' - Ralph Waldo Emerson. This quote is framed at the front of our room to remind us that we learn from each other as we work to become better readers, writers, mathematicians, and scientists. We are a neighborhood public school in the heart of Baltimore. Class sizes range from 20-28 and our students come from diverse socio-economic backgrounds. We are a Title I school serving the city of Baltimore and we offer after-school enrichment programs which are available to every student. Our students have weekly instruction in art and gym. Every spring teachers work with students to stage a school musical for which students audition and create set pieces and props. We are vibrant, but we struggle with funding, to say the least. Many of our students struggle with foundational skills in reading and math and work below grade-level. Small group instruction is an integral part of our classroom day. As a teacher, I supply my classroom with class library books, student book boxes, poetry journals, educational games, bookshelves and school supplies. These materials create a warm and inviting classroom in which my students work to become lifelong readers and learners.I am requesting 6 Chromebooks for daily use in my 3rd grade classroom. These Chromebooks will be used for independent work during instructional time in math, reading, writing, and science. Students will also be able to use these as they work on group projects exploring history and culture. 3rd graders are expected to demonstrate proficiency on standardized tests using computers, yet many of my students have no access to internet or computers at home. These Chromebooks will be instrumental in helping my under served kids gain critical literacy skills and demonstrate their knowledge. They are hungry for new experiences and they deserve to have access to necessary technology in their classroom which they may not have at home.
needStatement: My students need 6 Chromebooks to foster computer literacy and research skills for students who do not have computer or Internet access at home.

name: Too Hot To Learn
description: My students live in a city that has been ranked the number one most dangerous city in the country. Camden has a high level of poverty, and the problems in community are felt in our schools. Many of our students do not have strong parental support and guidance. We have students that go to school full-time, and work several part-time jobs to help sustain the livelihood of their families. While the students have an assortment of obstacles they face everyday, I also say that they are hard-working and intelligent individuals. It is my job to ensure that when they graduate; my students are prepared to be functioning citizens in society. As a teacher in a Title 1 school district, I observe that many of my student lack the basic necessities for school. I want my students to be successful in everything that they do. Many of my students come from low income families. They have to endure many difficulties that is too unbelievable to even fathom. School is often times their safe haven except for the hot months of May, June, September, and October. How can students possibly stay focused in class when their sweat is dripping down their faces and they are on the verge of fainting? My students attend a high school that is almost a hundred year old. All of the classrooms except for the main office have no AC and very little ventilation. During the hot months, some of my students fainted in the hallway. School is just too unbearable for these young learners when they have to deal with solving equations, breaking down formulas, and fanning themselves ferociously. Attendance in my classroom drop significantly during the hot months, because students don't want to stay in my hot classroom. A few of my colleagues who have air condition in their classrooms do not experience a drop in attendance. This air conditioner will definitely be a blessing to our classroom!
needStatement: My students need an air conditioner to stay focused during the hot weather.

name: Supply and Demand More for Our Classroom!
description: Outsiders might label our scholars at-risk because most of them are socioeconomically disadvantaged, our building is located in a high crime area, and the public does not expect a lot from our district. Meeting our scholars, you would describe them as open-minded inquirers ready to take on new challenges. Our students are here because they choose to take on the challenge of an International Baccalaureate (IB) program that will effectively prepare them for college, a goal they might be the first in their families to achieve. These supplies will allow our scholars to learn without the distraction of needing basic materials. Funding of this project will allow me to better outfit my classroom with needed supplies while ensuring students have what they need to succeed. Students need composition books, pens, and pencils to annotate readings, interpret information, and draft essays that will be important to their success. Basic organization and classroom tools like baskets and an X-ACTO electric pencil sharpener will allow us all to complete our tasks more efficiently. We also need Kleenex tissues, Bounty towels, and Lysol Disinfecting Wipes to keep clean. While students in my classes will be studying government, economics, and psychology, they will be practicing important life skills like research, analysis, interview, and presentation. In a modern media world that is becoming increasingly more difficult to interpret information, it has never been more important to develop strong critical thinking skills. Supplying these materials to our scholars will allow them to develop these skills more effectively and efficiently.
needStatement: My students need supplies, such as Mead composition books, Expo dry erase markers and cleaner, Bounty Towels, Lysol Disinfecting Wipes, Kleenex tissues, and Post-it Notes, to help meet basic needs and allow for learning to occur without distraction!

name: New Beautiful Carpet
description: I consider myself to be one of the most blessed people alive!!! I get the honor of teaching and sculpting small Kindergarten minds everyday. These kids are like my family and our room is full of kindness and love. These children live in a rural area and are part of working families doing the best they can. They are sweet, caring, kind and lovable!!! They try their best everyday and are very creative. They love to learn and come to school. Children need to have and make choices! Having this new carpet will give them better seating options and the freedom to be the learner they want and need to be. By allowing them to choose where the learning best suits them and having the control to make their own decisions, they can take charge of their own learning. Our carpet will provide comfort, space and will be able to be used as a learning tool where the children can use the letters for recognition and sound sorting centers. Your generous donation to our project will improve our Kindergarten classroom by building stronger readers and writers. This will change our students' lives for the better. They will love school and feel success at an early age --- having fun while learning!
needStatement: My students need a new, unstained rug for flexible seating. The rug we have is dull, faded and stained beyond cleaning.

name: Lucky Little Learners
description: I work in a small school with a tight knit community. The students in my class walk into school everyday with a smile on their face, eager to learn! My class is very diverse when it comes to their skill level but also their socioeconomic status and ethnicity. For many students, this is their first year of school and this is their first experience in life which makes my job even more important! I aim to make their first experience fun, successful, and engaging! My students are 4-5 years old and we sometimes have students that push into our classroom from the self-contained preschool classroom which is across the hall! Our district has been very fortunate to expand from 1/2 day to full day preschool. Our preschool uses a curriculum called 'Creative Curriculum'. This curriculum encourages students' interests and free choice in the classroom. That is why, this year I would like to incorporate students free choice of 'flexible seating' where students can read, journal write, play, and learn how they want. I have included a variety of materials where students can choose how they would like to sit when learning in the classroom or even taking these materials outside the classroom. We need flexible seating in the classroom! For example, students can take a carpet square, a yoga mat, a desk tray, or a sit spot with them when reading a book in the library or outside, when sitting on the carpet and using the environmental print to write in their journals, or however else they would like! These materials will help make preschool even more fun and engaging for my students!
needStatement: My students need flexible seating in the classroom! Brain research confirms that physical activity such as moving, stretching, and walking can actually enhance the learning process. Today's classrooms are changing... and for the better!

name: Growing Lifelong Readers!
description: My students love to learn, and they are becoming innovative learners, which supports them to achieve their goals. My fourth grade students are hard-working and excited learners who happen to come from homes in poverty. 96% of the students at our school qualify for free or reduced price lunch. Many of my students are struggling readers and writers and/or English Language Learners. Many of our students come to fourth grade with many academic gaps. Even though they face many struggles, my students always do their best and never give up. We are busy all year long in my classroom! Having extra materials such as pencils makes it possible for us to learn and stay productive! A pencil sharpener will also help us to always stay busy and prepared. During Reading time students will be able to choose from a more diverse selection of books. My students enjoy a variety of different books such as graphic novels, Diary of a Wimpy Kid, and Drama. These books will encourage my students to become life long readers by allowing them a variety to choose from. All of these materials will greatly help my students and allow them to have a successful school year!
needStatement: My students need books, pencils, and pencil sharpeners during Reading time.

name: Technology For Building Positive Peer Relationships
description: My school is located in an urban city. Many of our students are from low income immigrant households. My students are in grades Kindergarten to Fifth and some have difficulties maintaining positive peer relationships. Our students have a variety of socio and emotional needs and I want to provide them with all the options I can to make their year the best it can be! Students who are serviced by the School Counselor are usually at risk for poor academic and peer relationships. These students are usually frequent visitors and this can take away from their academic lessons. Computers in my office will allow me to expose students to websites that targets peer relationship scenarios. Also students who are ADHD and needs a quiet place to work can come to my office to complete assignments. This is helpful in preserving the students self esteem and relationship with their peers who might be distracted by their constant movement or fidgeting. It will also help them to be in a quiet and supportive environment. During Social Skills Group, it is my intention to utilize the computers to enhance each students experience in my office. During group time, students will be able to participate in character education programs to enhance their understanding of interpersonal skills. They will be able to cooperatively work together and learn skills that will be able to be applied to the classroom setting. Students with ADHD need a quiet setting to concentrate and have a productive work experience therefore, the use of a computer in my office will afford them to ability to successfully complete assignment.
needStatement: My students need technology when in my office in order to explore educational websites, visit websites that teach socio-emotional skills and gain exposure to character education. ADHD students can have a quiet place to complete assignments. My students need Fire Tablets.

name: Meeting the Needs of Each Child Through Flexible Seating
description: I teach at a Title 1 school in North Carolina where over 80% of our population are receiving free or reduced lunch. Our students come from many cultures, various backgrounds, and speak many languages. We strive daily to empower our students to be leaders and to take charge of their learning. Many of our students come from backgrounds where stability and a safe environment is hard to find. It is our job to create an environment in our classrooms where our students feel safe and free to use their voice and advocate for their education. Our school continually strives to stay on the cutting edge of research to provide the best possible learning environment for our students.I am requesting items that will allow my students more seating options in my classroom. Through my years of teaching I have found that many students are not comfortable or engaged in the traditional classroom environment of tables and chairs. The use of yoga balls and wobble stools in the place of traditional chairs will allow students more comfort and the ability to move as they need to. Bean bag chairs and pillows will be used for students who prefer to learn closer to the ground or laying down. The large carpet will provide a comfortable place for students to gather for whole group instruction or collaborative team tasks. By providing a more flexible, student-centered seating arrangement, I am able to capitalize on valuable teaching opportunities for students who need to move often or who prefer to sit on the floor or stand as they learn. In the past I have been able to accommodate a few students in providing more flexible seating options and have seen the tremendous impact it made on their enjoyment of learning and motivation in the classroom. By gifting all of my students with these items it will give them the tools they need to maximize their potential as learners and leaders.
needStatement: My students need the option to learn in a way that is most comfortable for each of their individual needs. This includes options like: yoga balls, wobble stools, bean bag chairs, and pillows on floor.

name: Hot Dots for Math
description: I will be teaching 1st grade again this year, but in a brand new school. Not only will my school be new, but the school community will be new also. My district is the same, but as the district grows new schools are needed. My school will take current students from each of the buildings and create a new student body. One thing I'm very excited about is being a part of this new community. We will all be able to learn and grow together. Everyone will be new. Although many students in my district have difficulties to face on a daily basis, all the students are special and unique and I am lucky to be a part of their lives. I teach math daily and love the ideas of these hot dot math activities. I do 3 rotations daily and these hot dots will be a great addition to math time. My students will use the hot dots daily during their rotations. They will be able to practice 1st grade math skills such as addition, subtraction, and place value. It is my job as a teacher to make sure my students are learning everything they need to know. It is my job as a teacher to make learning fun and meaningful. These hot dots are the latest tool that makes learning fun. I love knowing my students will be playing while learning at the same time.
needStatement: My students need hot dot math sets to use during Daily 3. These sets will allow my students to practice addition and place value.

name: Fun, Flexible Seating for First Grade
description: My students are critical and creative thinkers. They are energetic and like to move around. Most of all they want to learn and do their best. Our students are encouraged to questions, imagine possibilities, work collaboratively, create innovative solutions and always look for ways to improve. We are a STEAM based charter school in Wake Forest, North Carolina. We believe in hands-on, real world, problem-based learning. Students in middle school are given a concept or scenario and are asked to become engineers, using the engineering design process, to tackle the problem with creative solutions, while learning the required Common Core Standards. I love being able to give my students choice in their learning. Giving them the option of choosing which seating style helps them learn best will make them feel motivated and confident to learn all throughout the school day. My students would love having wobble chairs and wobble cushions as an alternative seating method, so they can move around while they are working without distracting their classmates. These have been very popular in my classroom because it allows students the ability to stay engaged in learning while moving and not distracting their peers. Not all students learn the same way, so we cannot expect all students to sit the same way. A comfortable learning environment is crucial to making students feel comfortable in the classroom. My students would benefit greatly from having flexible seating options, and I know it will make a great difference in their learning.
needStatement: My students need flexible seating options so that they have the opportunity to move around during the day while staying on-task.

name: Books to Expand Cultural Awareness
description: I teach 2nd grade at a school where students of color are a small portion of the student body. We are a fast-growing school with learners who need exposure to new ideas and ways of thinking. With a large population of of students who do not regularly see a wide variety of ethnicities and cultural representations, it is crucial to expose these amazing students to a wider world. Our students are open to new ideas and learning about these cultures will be very beneficial from now and into the future of their lives.I teach 2nd grade at a school where students of color are a small portion of the student body. With a large population of of students who do not regularly see a wide variety of ethnicities and cultural representations, it is crucial that children see others represented in literature in order to broaden their understanding of the world. As with most public schools, we have limited resources to fund our library and this is an area where all students would benefit in our school. I am asking for these book sets to significantly increase the cultural representation of students in literature in 5 classroom libraries. The goal is to have five separate sets of books that can rotate between our classrooms throughout the year increasing the number of excellent books available and the number of students exposed to this rich text. We will purchase books based on excellence in content and story that represent marginalized groups as authors and illustrators as well as main characters in stories. All funds will be utilized for the purchase of books that will be high-interest and last for years and years to come! Help us expand the minds of our kids by helping to expand this important part of our library.
needStatement: My students need multicultural books to to broaden their understanding of the world.

name: Warriors Excelling In Battle
description: I am a Pre-Algebra and Algebra 1 teacher and will be teaching all 8th graders that have various learning abilities. However, I also help with various sports teams at our school. My students are from a small community that is very family oriented. A lot of students that were born in the area will continue to live in the area beyond graduation. My students come from various socioeconomic statuses. Some can afford to get proper equipment, however, some can not. I do not want any to be at a disadvantage because of their home life. Every student athlete deserves the tools to perform at a high level. Your donations to this project will help ensure that our student athletes stay safe while playing the sport of baseball. Supplies in the project will also allow the team to have multiple stations going at once so that we can diversify the activities going on at once. These supplies are a large cost to our team and will allow us to allocate fundraiser money towards other items needed to help our team succeed. Our Warriors love to compete and we want to prepare them for the next level with proper equipment to keep them safe on the field of battle!
needStatement: My students need the helmets to keep them safe while hitting, balls for practice, and bat weight to help with the speed of their swing.

name: Calm Colors and Clean Carpet for Circle Time
description: As a teacher of 4K in a public school district my students come into my classroom as 'at risk' due to an early intervention need. My students are faced with several challenges both in and out of the classroom. Despite the many challenges they face, I look forward to meeting my students where there are and challenging them to rise up to their best learning potential. My students are creative, clever and very spontaneous. They like to move, they love interactive learning and love lots of positive attention. Many of them are being raised in single parent households and receive a free lunch based on their socioeconomic status. These things may prevent them from getting ahead early in life and may not provide them with the life experiences many of us see as 'typical'. From the minute they walk in the door of my classroom I focus on their potential and growth while they are with me. I may not be able to control their home lives, however, I can certainly control their experience during the school day. By doing this in a creative and positive way, I am hopeful to inspire even our earliest learner. One area my students struggle the most with is listening without distractions. Having taught in other 4K programs, I know first hand how how distracting a circle time rug can be as students will notice a speck of paper or piece of tape and become distracted from a great learning opportunity. I'm requesting one large circle time carpet for my students as their current circle time carpet is severely stained and left with tape residue from years of use. This carpet is where most of our learning will occur such as morning meeting, large group learning, small group literacy and math, and center time blocks. In my classroom, we practice listening and speaking daily using cooperative learning strategies. The addition of a nice clean rug would give my students a much needed boost of practice in the areas of listening and speaking as they will feel less distracted by stains and sticky tape residue and become more engaged in activities that promote their learning. Students who are not distracted learn to self-regulate and engage in their own learning.
needStatement: My students need a new circle time rug to replace the old worn and stained rug in our classroom.

name: Teaching With Technology!
description: Hi everyone! I am a 3rd-4th grade teacher looking to provide the best for my students! This is my third school year teaching, but it will be my first year teaching BD!My students are in a behavioral classroom within a public school in Paterson, NJ. My classroom services students from 3rd to 4th grade with up to 12 students. With school funding being extremely low, any donation can make a difference inside the classroom! We are looking for new supplies and technology. Having technology in the classroom would be extremely beneficial for BD, allowing them to be more hands on and successful. I've also included in the donation some bean bags, while these will be very helpful in our classroom library during independent quiet reading time!Having technology in the classroom such as iPads will be beneficial for my students. The donations for this project will improve my classroom by reducing the amount of behavioral issues. These donations will mean so much for the the kids because it will allow them to be hands on and successful during lessons. They will use these during both individual time as well as paired group instruction. Right now each classroom typically has about 3 computers in them. Having iPads funded will allow my students the opportunity to not only play games on them during free time, but I will incorporate lessons into the technology, making class much more fun and engaging for all of my students! I am looking forward to a successful school year and thank everyone for any donations that are made! :)
needStatement: My students need iPads for the technology part of learning in the classroom! They also need protective cases to keep their iPads in good condition. Bean bags are also for our classroom library!

name: Inspire My Students To Take Action In Our Multilingual Community!
description: My students are AMAZING 2nd grade bilingual learners ready to take on the world! Most of them are English Language Learners and their families come from countries around the world, living the American Dream. The rest of the students are native English speakers learning Spanish, becoming empowered and compassionate citizens by living and learning in another language, culture, and perspective. Many of my students struggle with issues of poverty and access to academic experiences. Fortunately, bilingual education is one of the best ways to close the achievement gap and to break down barriers of racism and socioeconomics! Actually, if a student is allowed to learn in their native language, they acquire English at a better and faster rate than those who do not. And they also have bilingual skills to share with the world and to learn about other cultures and perspectives! Unfortunately, I do not have sufficient materials in Spanish to help support their learning...this is why I need your help! Any donations will directly affect over 50 students as I teach 2 classrooms of students a day (they rotate with an English teacher). I will also use them for years and years to come! Help get 2nd graders interested in how a community works and how they can become productive members in our local and global community! We will also be learning Spanish as we read these wonderful and engaging books about communities near and far. At the same time I will also use our classroom as an example of a mini community as they use the clipboards and folders to work as a team to investigate and make changes in our own community. They will use the take home book bags to borrow these books to take home to share with their families, who are mostly Spanish speakers. The notebooks they will use to take notes and make maps about what they observe in their community and what needs to be improved. They will feel very important with their fancy folders, clipboards, and book bags, thus more likely they will use them and realize that they too have interesting ideas and input to share. We will write letters to community members and learn about our own community and different communities in our state. Finally, we will compare those to different communities around the world and write letters to students in those communities. We can connect with the world and realize our power to change it! Please help us learn about ourselves and how we are apart of a global community!
needStatement: My students need books about community in Spanish and journals, folders, book bags, and clipboards to take notes and organize their group projects about our community and how they can make a difference in it!

name: The Reeding Rainbow
description: My students are hardworking, persistent and passionate young musicians who deserve the best. They are from the inner city. Some are from poverty, homelessness, and broken families. However, what the students do have, they protect and work hard for. My students are the greatest middle school kids ever! In band, we teach them life skills that will help them rise above difficult situations and become stronger citizens. Music is a passion and wonderful form of expression for these kids! Help us reach our music goals and strive for the highest!My students are 6th and 7th grade band members. To help us get started making music, my kids need some help getting reeds in their hands! Without reeds, the clarinet and saxophone cannot make any sound. The band would not be the same without these instruments!Help our band out by helping us get the reeds we need so that we can make beautiful music! We will use these reeds everyday, in concerts, pep rallies, competitions, and for solos! Reeds break down over time, so many reeds are needed per student to help get them through the entire year. Your support is awesome and is appreciated by our band family!
needStatement: My students need reeds! Without the clarinets and saxophones, my band would not be the same!

name: Outdoor Classroom Chairs
description: Students at our school are in 6th, 7th, or 8th grade. Over 60% of our students are in a low economic situation. All students get free breakfast at our school. By funding our school, you are helping to enrich the lives of our students. Students need a positive learning environment to truly show their potential. Projects like this are important to show that the teacher cares about his or her students. Please support my project today. Thank you for considering. These classroom chairs are needed to create an outside classroom learning space that will be conducive to learning. Students need to learn outside the four walls of their classroom. Taking these chairs outside will help develop better learning skills for all of my students. Students who spend time outside are more likely to grasp important concepts. We role play skits and other forms of learning history in my class. These chairs would allow us to go outside and not worry about grass stains, mud, or muck. Any help with my project would be greatly appreciated. Thank you so much!
needStatement: My students need 25 Logo chairs so we can create an outdoor classroom.

name: Supplies for Super Second Graders!
description: As a teacher in a low-income neighborhood in Milwaukee, school is a safe haven for my students. They come to school with baggage that we as adults can't fathom. It is up to me to lift their spirits and show them that they can be successful. It is up to me to be more than a teacher to my students. I am mom, dad, nurse, etc.,. I create engaging lessons and a warm, loving environment for my students. When my students enter my class, they know they are cared for. In return, they show me they are ready to learn. I have shown some of my toughest students that they are loved and can be something in life. My students come to school ready to learn. In order for my students to learn, we needs supplies. The supplies on this list will be used by my students and by me so that I can prepare engaging lessons. I have included different types of items for the different needs. The fans will be used to cool us down since we do not have air condition in our school. We will be starting school earlier in August which means that my students will have a hard time learning if we have no air circulation. The printer toner is for a printer I purchased since we only have one printer for staff to access. I save time by having my own printer that I can print tasks off immediately when need be. The lap desks will come in handy when we do small group in the carpet. They often bring books to write on but that gets uncomfortable after a while. The markers and chart paper are for me to make anchor charts to post around the room for my students to reference.
needStatement: My students need supplies so they can have a successful year.

name: Curious First Graders Need Laptops
description: My students attend title a one school in Florida. C. Elementary is a 100% free and reduced lunch school. The majority of my students' home language is Spanish and are learning English in school. Everyday they come to school eager to learn and full of questions. This year I am teaching a group of very bright first graders. I would love to challenge this group by doing projects. Many of my students do not have access to computers at home. Doing projects and learning computer skills is very difficult to complete in class with the limited amount of computers my school provides. In a world that relies so much on technology it is important to teach students how to use it. We use it everyday as adults to answer questions we have. Imagine all the questions my students will answer by the use of this technology! By having four laptops in my room students will be able to learn how to type and research their questions. They will be using these laptops during reading and math small groups. Students will be completing projects that they need to research and create presentations that they will share with the class. Laptops will help students that need extra help with their reading and math skills.
needStatement: My students need 4 laptops in order to complete different kinds of projects that will challenge them.

name: Book Binding Buddies
description: I teach at a high poverty school full of energetic, eager-to-learn students. They come to kindergarten on a variety of levels and from a variety of backgrounds. They all want to be successful. The best part about kindergarten is they can have fun with just about any lesson. It is my job to see to it that school can be a fun place even while they are learning. We make every day special for everyone by having fun while becoming successful learners. My kindergarten students always have a story to tell. They get so excited when they write a story but they want it to be like the books they read. I want to help them turn their stories into books they can be proud of. This binding machine will allow my students the opportunity to turn their creative stories into books they can share with their friends and families. My students love to write and we need to keep that excitement going any way we can. I want them to create books they can read again and again. Let's create a room full of authors.
needStatement: My students need a binding machine to bind the books they write.

name: A Hands-on Kindergarten
description: I am entering my second year teaching in a low-income/high poverty school district. My students are faced with several challenges both in and out of the classroom. Many enter school without the same learning experiences and opportunities of their more affluent peers. Despite the many challenges they face, I am looking to provide my students with the tools and knowledge needed to be successful learners. My kindergarten students are creative, clever and very spontaneous. They like to move, they love to read and love lots of positive attention. From the minute they walk in the door of my classroom I focus on their potential and growth while they are with me. I may not be able to control their home lives, however, I can certainly control their experience during the school day. By doing this in a creative and positive way, I am hopeful to inspire even our earliest learners to continue on a path of academic excellence. My low-income kindergarten classroom needs some fresh new hands-on materials to help my students learn and grow. Our current materials are old, dusty, broken and missing parts. The students will benefit so much by having developmentally appropriate materials to manipulate, care for and share. Without some new materials, I see the fun and excitement being limited. School at this age should be fun and exciting.A new easel will give me a place to model writing, read big books and and teach phonics skills with magnet letters. I currently have an old painting easel which is too small for chart paper, big books, and it is not magnetic. A new easel will greatly improve my literacy instruction. The math and literacy materials are loaded with hands-on learning materials. Having engaging educational materials is vital to smooth running centers. The bundle covers literacy, math and science activities that are tied to common core standards. The bundle is everything that kindergarten should be - fun, engaging and educational. This little project of mine will change lives. It will educate, stimulate and create a positive classroom environment. Please help our classroom gather some necessary materials.
needStatement: My students need access to big books and hands-on learning materials. We need an easel and more.

name: Learn, LEAD, Roar!
description: We are a Chicago public school serving students in grades PreK through 8. Students travel from all over the City of Chicago to come to our school. Our students come from various cultural and socioeconomic backgrounds which makes our school all the more unique. We are a Math and Science Academy and we recently became a Leader In Me School. This means that we believe every student has genius and has something to contribute to the community. Leaders Grow Here!Learn, Lead, Roar! We are a Leader In Me School and this project will help fund our student incentive store. We are accentuating the positive this year and we are stocking up our Bobcat Store with supplies and other items for students to purchase with the Bobcat Bucks they earn! Students earn Bobcat Bucks from school staff members for making good choices and exhibiting leadership skills. This year we would like to stock our store with plenty of items from necessary school supplies to fun free time trinkets. Not every family is able to bring in brand new school supplies on the first day of school. Our store will be stocked with school supplies that students can purchase with their Bobcat Bucks. School supplies being requested are: binders, folders, lined paper, algebraic calculators, pencils, erasers, markers, crayons, colored pencils, sharpeners, scissors, glue, and flash drives. In addition to necessity items, we are also including things like bookmarks, locker accessories, and games. Items requested include: brain teaser puzzles, puzzle cubes, locker mirrors and whiteboards, earbuds, phone accessories, stress balls, play doh, and colored glue for students to use to make their own slime (colored glue). Imagine the sense of pride and accomplishment a student will feel when they are able to spend their own 'money' to purchase items THEY get to choose. We believe that everyone has genius and something to offer to the community! The store is run by our very own student leaders! What a great way to build up students' self esteem and teach personal responsibility! Students will be so excited this year when they see all of the new items for 'sale' this year!
needStatement: My students need various items for our, Bobcat Store (student incentive store)! Students will purchase items from our store with Bobcat Bucks they earn!

name: Taste of My World!
description: I work with wonderful kindergarten intervention students. Most of my students are English Language Learners and/or are considered economically disadvantaged. Many of the students in my school live in very challenging living conditions. My students are typically youngest in their grade level and still need time to develop language and social skills. My students are full of diversity and together we make a wonderful community! They enjoy learning the English language and getting to know new friends. Each day students have time to explore different centers in class to allow them time to work on developing their language and social skills. This dramatic play center will allow students to learn about community helpers, role play, practice math skills through measuring and counting, problem solve, practice writing through making lists and taking orders, and have meaningful conversations while expanding speaking and listening skills. This center will also help students learn more about cultural diversity and food from around the world. It will give students the materials needed to help them learn through play. The kitchen and food will give students the opportunity to practice language development and social by interacting with their peers. I think this new center will excite my students because they will get to explore their own culture with food from around the world!
needStatement: My students need a dramatic play area with dishes and food to develop oral language and social skills. This area will provide purposeful play that will incorporate all subjects.

name: Notebooks to Teach Tolerance
description: I teach social studies to 9th graders in a high-poverty neighborhood. Many of my students are below grade level. The school where I teach is a diverse public high school: 23% of students are African American, 19% Hispanic, 16% Asian, 2% Native American, and 36% Caucasian. Many of my students struggle with challenges outside of school. Over 70% of our students are below the poverty line. Many students are in the foster care system or are homeless. Many are recent immigrants learning English as a second language. I have amazing students who use their diversity and life experiences to their advantage. My students are from Ethiopia, Somalia, Rwanda, Vietnam, Mexico, Guatemala, Myanmar (Burma), Thailand, Micronesia, the Democratic Republic of the Congo, and other places around the world. This year I teach freshman world history and two sheltered versions of history for English language learners. Some of my students have just moved to the United States and are beginning to learn English. In my class, my students will learn about the world and other cultures. In my history classes and at our school we engage students in community building restorative justice circles. In these circles we discuss current events, equity, race, and justice. Assumptions and stereotypes are challenged. Tolerance and empathy are promoted. It is essential that success be possible for all students, including those from the bottom of the social scale as well as those in the middle and top. Regular and routine use of restorative justice circles helps create a healthy school community. Circles support individual learning and growth while at the same time supporting a healthy class or school community. I want to engage my students in restorative justice circles to promote social justice, diversity, and acceptance. In my social studies courses (government, economics, and world history) I choose units that promote tolerance. Circles will help my students respect, appreciated, accept diverse voices and perspectives from world cultures. We need supplies to run effective restorative justice circles like a notebooks to record questions, learning, and thinking.
needStatement: My students need notebooks to record their learning, thinking, and questions.

name: Feed Our Students Delicious Reads During Our Fall Reading Frenzy!
description: Our students attend a rural public high school, which serves about 650 students. We are located in an area where the socioeconomic status of many residents is low. Many students have parents who are out of work. Our school relies heavily on state funding and this year, we are struggling once again due to the state not coming through with that funding. Programs and teachers are being cut and our students are feeling the brunt. Our students are creative and kind and they strive to reach their goals no matter what obstacles they face. They continue to achieve successfully despite more challenges and fewer resources. They forge ahead without complaints. Although funds are low, our students' passion for books hasn't dulled one bit. Please help keep this thirst for literature alive by supporting our school. Strong literacy skills help students excel in every aspect of their personal and professional lives. Providing fresh fiction and nonfiction books in our library will help spark students' interest in reading, thus encouraging them to become strong, lifelong readers. Our educators work harder every year to strengthen our sustained silent reading program and encouraging students to read in their free time. The more resources we have in our library, the more likely the kids will be to embrace this program and not only find something that meets their reading needs, but also helps them embrace being a reader for life.
needStatement: My students need new fiction and nonfiction books to help them start this school year off right!

name: Schoolwide Social Emotional Learning
description: I am the School Counselor at a very low socioeconomic school. I want to bring materials to the school that will help build on Social Emotional Learning. My students currently do not have enough tangible resources to actively engage in these lessons. Social Emotional Learning is a big component in my school and I want to foster a safe and nurturing environment for all students to learn. I want to be able to provide for my students and afford them opportunities they may not otherwise have. This project will provide books and activities to enrich Social Emotional Learning. I will be able to go into classrooms and present class room lessons to each class. Social Emotional Learning is very important to students academic excellence. If a student wants to succeed academically, the adults in their life need to make sure that their social and emotional needs are being met. With these materials, I will be teaching anti-bullying, good manners, personal space, character education (responsibility, cooperation, trustworthiness, kindness, respect, honesty, self-control, and tolerance). My goal is to promote positive Social Emotional growth from Pre-k through 5th grade. Each grade level will learn different strategies to foster a safe and nurturing learning environment. I will be reading the 'Are You A Bucket Filler' book to each class and 'The Energy Bus' to encourage kind words and including positive people in our lives. I will be doing hands on activities and promoting a school wide initiative to 'Be a Bucket Filler' at Markham Elementary. Each material picked out will help build knowledge and awareness to many character traits. Anti-bullying is a platform I stand strongly behind and want to creatively show students that it's not okay to bully and put others down. I will be going into each classroom and doing classroom guidance lessons. All Character Education traits promoted in Broward County will be implemented in the school.
needStatement: My students need materials like anti-bullying bracelets to encourage and enrich Social Emotional Learning.

name: View From the Carpet!
description: Kindergarten is a special time in a student's life. For many of my students, this is their first time in the classroom setting. I work at an elementary school in South Seattle. We have a very high immigrant population and over 80% of our students receive free or reduced lunch. Students are figuring out who they are in the classroom and school environment. Last year, 2/3 of my students were English Language Learners. With support from teachers and family, my students were able to show a tremendous amount of growth. Much of Kindergarten instruction happens on 'The Rug'. To effectively teach on this magical spot, I needed a dry erase easel to teach important academic content. My school was generous enough to donate one from the conference room but it was one meant for 'grown ups'. The easel would constantly tip over from excited students ready to show what they have learned. The safety hazard is the biggest reason for this project. The new easel is kid friend and cannot tip over and will help to ensure that all students, even the ones in the back row, are able to see and access the content. Thank you so much for your consideration.
needStatement: My students need an easel for fair access to all the content in class.

name: Comfortable Spots = Focused Readers!
description: I teach an enthusiastic class of 2nd and 3rd graders whose interests are as diverse as they are. They walk into the classroom every day ready to learn. Watching my students succeed and become confident learners inspires me to find more ways to support them. My school is an urban option school that parents can choose for their children. I have many students with special education needs including learning disabilities, Autism-Spectrum Disorder, Sensory Processing Disorder and ADHD. These special needs can impact their ability to access the skills and concepts I am teaching. During our independent reading time each day, my students find spots around our classroom to read their books. Two or three kids get to be cozy in our classroom library, but the remaining children have to sit on the floor or at their tables. Bean bags and wobble cushions will allow more kids to have comfortable spots for reading. And when they feel comfortable, they will be more focused readers! In addition, when small groups meet with me for individualized instruction, they will no longer have to gather around me on the floor. Instead, they will have stools on which to sit.
needStatement: My students need seating to be cozy and comfortable while they read!

name: We Don't Tolerate Intolerance
description: Seeing my students learn is the thing that makes me the happiest. I love to be able to give them all the information that they need in order to understand and appreciate the world that they live in. Curious, creative, and very vocal, my students are the future of our society and I want to make sure they are equipped and ready to handle it. Faced with some difficult obstacles that they have to go through in their own neighborhood, I want them to know that the obstacles in the classroom can be overcome. With hard work and determination they will become the best of our future. Using the iPad my students will be able to find strategies on hot to deal with intolerance and bullying. We will do an investigation into the different ways to stop a bully and how to accept people for who they are, regardless of size, shape or color. In a perfect world our children are shielded from the ugliness that adults show towards one another. But in the real world, we know that is not true. Our students need to learn that we have to be accepting of others and practice being tolerant to each other both in and out of the classroom.
needStatement: My students need an iPad which will help them find different ways to fight intolerance.

name: Color Me Happy
description: Seeing my students learn is the thing that makes me the happiest. I love to be able to give them all the information that they need in order to understand and appreciate the world that they live in. Curious, creative, and very vocal, my students are the future of our society and I want to make sure they are equipped and ready to handle it. Faced with some difficult obstacles that they have to go through in their own neighborhood, I want them to know that the obstacles in the classroom can be overcome. With hard work and determination they will become the best of our future. When we want to get creative in our classroom, it becomes a fun time but also a stressful time. My students need crayons, colored pencils and paper to use for their projects. I have students that come in with little or no schools supplies. We quickly run out of crayons and colored pencils before the school year is even half way over. I want them to be able to get creative and do their best with ample materials to get us through the school year. We do share with each other, but it's easier to get through a lesson when everyone has their own supplies.
needStatement: My students need crayons, paper and colored pencils for the classroom.

name: Learning Responsibility
description: My students primarily come from an underprivileged population in an urban environment. Many of my students do not have the resources at home to maximize their learning potential. It is my goal, then, to provide them with the best tools and resources possible for the time that they are in my classroom. I believe that every one of my students can be college-bound, despite the fact that many of them come from families where this has not been a reality. In order to achieve this goal, my students will need a variety of tools to meet their needs as individual learners. My students need a variety of materials to help them stay organized this school year. I am asking for folders in four different colors so that students can have one folder for each subject. I am asking for pencil pouches to organize individual materials. I am also asking for labels so that students can easily identify their own materials. As teachers, our job is not only to teach academics, but to teach life skills, including responsibility. Having a system to organize their own papers and materials helps students to develop responsibility. Through your donations, I will be able to work with my students on this important skill that will remain with them for the rest of their lives.
needStatement: My students need folders, pencil boxes, and pencil pouches to stay organized and learn responsibility.

name: Word Builders Lay a Good Foundation
description: As a teacher in a high-poverty, low-income school district, my students are faced with challenges both in and out of the classroom. My school is a Title I school, and we have an extremely high percentage of students who receive free/reduced lunches. Many of my students' families were not able to afford school supplies, so I purchased what my students' needed out of pocket. This is usually what has to be done if you want your students to have the materials that they need. My students are extremely eager to learn new things. My kindergarten students need to learn the basic skills needed to become successful readers, and having phonological awareness is a requirement for that. These word building boards will make a huge impact on my small-group reading instruction. Students will be able to physically place letters together in the open section on the board, say each sound, and quickly move their finger under the word to blend the sounds together to form a word. Understanding phonological awareness and blending are extremely important skills that are the foundation of reading. Our class will use these boards daily in small-group instruction. We will practice putting words together, changing the onset and rime of words, and practice saying each individual letter sound. These kits will greatly impact our word-building skills.
needStatement: My students need word building boards to support their ever-growing blending skills!

name: Pick a Seat!
description: My students are a group of very curious and intelligent 3rd graders. My students love making jokes, playing soccer and telling stories. The kids I have this year have especially taken an interest to reading graphic novels and writing non-fiction books about topics they love. The majority of my kids don't have access to books at home, so learning to read and write in school is especially crucial to their learning. I teach at a Title I school with a population of over 80% minority students. Many of my students are English Language Learners and several also come from migrant families. My school has over 70% free/reduced lunch, meaning many children also come from low-income households. I need more flexible seating options for my students to use during centers and individual work time. Last year I received a donors choose donation for 4 wobble chairs and it made a HUGE difference in my classroom! The wobble chairs helped my wiggly students focus while also helping my reluctant learners want to come to small group instruction. While these chairs have been such a wonderful tool in my classroom, we are in high need of more options that can help students stay active while learning. If I had more wobble chairs along with balancing boards and balancing pods, I could meet the learning needs of all my students. My goal is to have several seating choices available for all children, so they can choose what piece of furniture works best for their needs. If I had these materials, I would be able to let all students have an opportunity to move while they work independently and in small groups.
needStatement: My students need flexible seating options to choose from during work time.

name: Dominguez's Scholars Seize Learning
description: The minute you meet these fourth graders you know they are eager to learn! These students bubbled over with an incredible amount of excitement the minute I met them. Their curiosity is contagious. These scholars are ready for a challenge and hungry to learn! I relish their enthusiasm! What better than to know these students will be future leaders. Sky is the limit when it comes to learning. They are soaring for success. I am honored to be their teacher. Students in fourth grade are really preparing for a middle school transition in just two years. One way to best prepare them is to help them stay organized. Chair pockets will allow students to have ample room to keep all of their materials. Having less items in their desk will allow for rapid transitions. Star student work will shine in our room! Another way to prepare students is to help them work on presentation. The supplies will help students create a high quality final product. This is a skill that needs to be nurtured and modeled on a continual basis in order to achieve mastery.
needStatement: My students need supplies such as At-Your-Seat Storage Sacks to stay organized and turn in quality work.

name: Chromebooks for Communication, Collaboration, and Creativity
description: I teach at an inner city Chicago Public School on the south side of Chicago. I am a Learning Behavior Specialist, which is a fancy way of saying Special Education teacher. I teach 7th and 8th grade diverse learners for Language Arts and Math. Their disabilities range from high-incidence to low-incidence and each child has a unique IEP (Individual Education Plan). My students face many challenges living in a poverty-stricken neighborhood. Additionally, there is an increase in violence and gang activity right outside their homes. Despite their adversities, all of my students come to school everyday, eager to learn and their curious minds are my motivation. I am excited for this school year and all the adventures that lie ahead. We are a STEM school and our mission is to enrich our students in all areas of science, technology, engineering, and math. Our world has become increasingly centered around technology. Many jobs today require hands-on experience with various forms of technology. In order for my students to be college and career ready, I want them to have daily access to technology in their classroom. I want to have a virtual Google Classroom where we can collaborate, communicate, and use our creativity for various tasks including research projects and the engineering design process. My students all have special needs and the Chromebooks will help them to reach their full potential. I want to integrate the Chromebooks into daily learning so they attain proficiency in using various Google applications. To do all of that, we need these Chromebooks!
needStatement: My students need Chromebooks to enrich their daily education through technology.

name: Multiplication Masters
description: My students are special because they are what make our school great! Students that attend this school are predominately Latino and low income, but there is a small European and Asian population. The families are caring and extremely hardworking. They have much fondness for the school and generations of families have been attending it since its infancy. Smiling faces fill this building daily and it's an amazing experience to witness it as a teacher. It's a great place to work and a wonderful place to learn!These materials will make a difference in my students' learning and improve their school lives because all students need to memorize their times tables by the end of third grade and these flashcards will help them do just that. Having this class set of flashcards enables students to practice multiplying in the classroom with a buddy or even by themselves.
